Essay to score:
"Attending school in person is considered the worst way to participate in classes by some. Online or video conferencing could benefit students, allowing them to attend classes more conveniently. Although there are advantages to physically going to school, taking classes from home means students don't have to worry about bullying by classmates, being late because there's no need to travel, and lacking food to eat at school.

Waking up early every morning for school can be very stressful. Students have to take a shower, brush their teeth, some girls apply makeup, and then pack their school bags. Often, students feel too lazy to get out of bed, resulting in them missing the bus. Consequently, they might have to stay home, wait for a ride, or even walk to school. Most students don't get enough sleep, which impairs their focus in class. Hunger can also be a distraction, making things worse. When working online, students may choose the time that suits them best and stay at home, eliminating the need to worry about their appearance.

Attending online classes means there are no classmates present, which can be beneficial. Without classmates, students can concentrate on their work, as there are no distractions from noise or other disruptions. Since they're not in a physical classroom, there's no risk of being bullied, teased, or judged. Bullying can lead to depression in school for some students, whether it's about their dress, looks, smell, or past actions. This can result in students no longer wanting to attend school. Therefore, in online classes, students work independently, which can lead to greater focus on schoolwork.

What are the benefits of attending classes in person at school? By going to school, students can communicate with others and make friends. They can ask teachers or friends for additional help. Since the student is out of the house, parents save money as the electric bill will be lower. By attending school, students can participate in sports or after-school programs that may help them choose their career, rather than being cooped up at home.

In conclusion, attending classes online can benefit students. It is the best way to receive an education for those who prioritize safety from bullies, no distractions from classmates, always having food available to maintain focus, and the flexibility of scheduling classes according to the student's own time."

Individuals who litter should receive a ticket because they contribute to the degradation of our environment.

To encourage students to participate in community service, we should make it an enjoyable experience so they do not find it tedious. Littering occurs everywhere and at all times, and those who litter should understand that they are harming not only themselves but everyone, including children and babies who will suffer the consequences in the future.

Some people have carelessly discarded drinks into the water at beaches, causing harm to both humans and animals in various ways.

There are those who take the initiative to perform community service, ensuring clean streets and a better future for their children. Nowadays, many people face problems due to the littering habits of others, which makes the world a less pleasant place to live. Those who litter should be issued tickets.

In my opinion, we should implement community service programs in Stamford public schools. I urge the principals to consider introducing community service in middle and high schools. To everyone on the streets: STOP LITTERING so that we may one day have a better world without the health issues caused by litter. I am appealing to all the principals in Stamford to support student involvement in community service.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]"

Essay to score:
"The idea of a four-day work week, with each day consisting of ten hours, is good for banks, offices, and other departments. However, in school, some students cannot stay for such an extended period consistently for four days. There are students who would like to have a four-day school week, but extending it by two hours would not be good for them. Spending ten hours in school is akin to students spending the whole day there and coming home just to sleep. Some students have jobs after school, and others take care of their little brother or sister while their parents are not at home. Some students might be happy with this, but they do not realize how tired they will become. Schools should not follow this model by extending the school day by two hours because students will not have much time left to do their homework and other extracurricular activities. Some students work after school, and they do not get much time to spend with their families. 

Schools should not adopt this four-day school week model with an extended school day because students will not have enough time for homework and extracurricular activities. If students spend ten hours at school, they will not have time to play video games or participate in sports such as soccer, football, basketball, and cricket. They will also lack time for homework and sleep. If students come home from school and sleep, they may not be able to sleep at night, and if they cannot wake up in the morning, they may become ill. Students need to refresh their minds by sleeping for one or two hours after they return from school and engage in activities like games. They need more time; if they spend ten hours at school just studying, they come home tired and are unable to do anything or understand the material at school. If they cannot understand the material, they might fail in class, which could be problematic. With the amount of homework and tests/quizzes they have every day, they cannot study adequately in such a limited time. They also need more rest to refresh their minds. Therefore, schools should not allow a ten-hour extension because students will not have enough time to prepare for tests/quizzes, do their homework, or rest. 

Schools should not follow this model by extending the school day by two hours because some students work after school. If schools extend the day by two hours, some students may lose their jobs because they go directly from school to work. Some students work to save money for college or university fees or to help their parents. Immigrant families who have recently arrived in the country may not have much money, so their high school children also work to support their parents. If schools extend the day by two hours, those students who have jobs may lose them and struggle to survive. Students who work the entire week will lose their right to do anything else if the school day is extended, causing significant hardship in their lives. A student who has big dreams and works to save for college will be deeply affected by the loss of their job and may give up. If schools extend the day by two hours, some students may have to change their job schedules, resulting in them coming home late and not having time to do schoolwork or study for tests. Schools should not follow this model because it does not help students who work after school. 

Schools should not follow this model by extending the school day by two hours because students will not have much time to spend with their families. If schools extend the day, some students will not be able to spend time with their families, especially if their parents work on weekends and cannot see their children. When students come back from school, they will be tired and will only want to sleep. 

If schools extend the day by two hours, students will not have time to go out; they may have a three-day weekend, but they might be too tired from spending four consecutive days of ten hours each at school. They might receive more homework because of the three-day weekends. They might become sick of all this and not want to talk to anyone at home. Extending the school day by two hours will distance students from their families. Spending time with family refreshes students' minds. If students do not spend time with their families, it can cause problems because their minds will be preoccupied with school, leaving no room for anything else. Therefore, schools should not follow this model because students need to spend time with their families. 

In conclusion, schools should not extend the school day by two hours because students will not have enough time for homework, extracurricular activities like games and sports, or to spend with their families. Some students have jobs after school, and the extended hours would significantly impact their lives."

"Have you ever thought about being successful? Some argue that it is better to work alone because it fosters responsibility and confidence. However, this is not the case. Although some people might argue it is better to work alone, actually it is better to work in a group because we can finish our work quickly and we can learn more or gain more knowledge.

The first reason that explains why it is better to work in a group is that we can finish our work quickly. For example, in my history class, some of the students chose to do their work on their own, and some chose to work in a group. The student that finished early would get a prize, and the students that chose to work in a group finished earlier and got the prize. It is better to work in a group because if we had not done the work in a group, we would not have finished early and won the prize. It is better to work in a group to finish our work quickly. Another example that supports this is a man who had to fix a lot of cars in two days to pay for his house rent. He could not do it on his own, so he called his friends to help him. They worked in a group, and he finished his work quickly and also paid for his house rent. It is better to work in a group because if the man had not finished fixing the cars, he would have been on the street. But because he worked in a group, he finished his work quickly and paid his rent.

The second reason is that it is better to work in a group because we can learn new things. For example, I didn't know how to create a pie chart for my chemistry presentation, and I asked my friends for help. They said, 'Let's teach each other in a group,' and they showed me how to do it. I got 100 on it. It is better to work in a group to learn new things because if I hadn't done my pie chart and presented it, I would have gotten a 0 in my grades. But because I worked in a group and learned, I got 100. Another example is a girl who did not know how to swim. Her sister and brother taught her, and they also taught each other how to swim in different ways in a group. She learned how to swim. It is better to work in a group to learn new things. If she had not learned how to swim, she could have drowned. But they taught her in a group, and she learned how to swim.

The other side might say it is better to work alone because we can be responsible and confident. However, we can be more responsible and more confident if we work together in a group. For example, there were a lot of kids learning how to ride a bike, but there was one kid who felt confident and did not want to learn with them. He was 11 years old and so confident that he could ride a bike by himself, but he could not because he was not in the group. He fell when he tried to ride the bike and hurt his leg. It is better to work in a group. If the kid had learned how to ride a bike in the group, he would not have fallen and hurt his leg. Another example is a boy I know who wanted to live by himself and moved into a big house, but he could not afford the rent. It is better to work in a group. If the boy had worked in a group and paid the rent with the group, he would have been able to afford it.

Although some people might argue it is better to work alone, actually it is better to work in a group because we can finish our work quickly and we can gain more experience or knowledge.

It is better to work in a group because working alone is not better than working in a group. When we work in a group, we will be safer, we can accomplish things more easily, finish quickly, and learn new things. It is better to work in a group to succeed."

Essay to score:
"Some schools always have problems regarding whether students graduating early is beneficial or not. While many people believe that graduating in three years is not good, they argue that the traditional four-year graduation is better because students will gain more experience and will be able to determine the career they want to pursue in college upon graduation.

To begin with, students who stay in high school for four years will have more experience. They will complete the classes required for graduation and may take subjects they are passionate about. Joining clubs at school allows students to learn more skills and develop their ability to speak for themselves. Some students participate in groups that volunteer to help others in school, engaging with many people and developing skills. These activities may even earn them credits for college. Additionally, students from other countries or those in ELL classes may learn at a slower pace and need more time to improve their English before graduating. High school teachers always provide support, helping students to develop quickly.

The second reason is that students will have the opportunity to discover their career interests. They can choose classes that align with their career goals. For example, if they are interested in a Marketing career, they can take DECA classes or an introduction to Marketing to support their career aspirations. Schools often organize meetings for students to discuss careers with representatives from colleges or universities they may consider after graduation. Counselors provide detailed support regarding skills, GPA, location, tuition, and scholarships, helping students choose the right career for their future.

Although students can graduate early in three years, they may feel pressured by their subjects. However, they can save a year to do something else, like entering college early, getting accustomed to the new environment, working, and earning money to support their life in college and pay for tuition. But these students may have less experience and be confused about their career in college because they have not fully developed their thinking, leading to potential time lost in learning and career exploration.

Finally, students should graduate traditionally in four years. They will be supported by more people in school, learn from a variety of classes, develop their social skills, and apply these skills to their career or life. Moreover, they will not waste time finding a suitable career with the help of counselors and teachers. In summary, graduating traditionally in four years is beneficial because it provides students with more advantages for their future work."

"Technology was created to facilitate human communication and improve other aspects, but now technology has negative effects on people's lives, including less personal communication with their families, friends, or all people around them. Moreover, it affects the physical health and mental well-being of those who use it.

Technology causes distractions and problems. For example, people don't pay attention when they use their phones to play games, watch videos, or text with their friends at school or in their jobs. This leads to poor communication and problems with their teachers or bosses, resulting in people taking online education and online jobs, which affects their ability to interact with new people and to learn about other opportunities within society.

The technology influences people to choose easier ways. For instance, fewer people use books to find information, go shopping, eat at restaurants, or play table games with their families or friends because they can find these activities on TV, computers, or phone applications. People would rather stay at home and acquire everything in an easy form, which is bad as they become lazier and lose the opportunity to share and talk more with their families or people around them.

Technology affects the physical health and mental well-being of its users. For example, some people have vision problems because they spend a lot of time on their phones or watching TV, and others have hearing problems because they use headphones with loud music for extended periods. All of these issues affect people's ability to communicate, as vision and hearing are forms that humans use to communicate with others.

In conclusion, technology has had negative effects on people's lives, affecting their communication, progress, and physical health, and therefore people have fewer opportunities in their present and it affects them in their future."

Essay to score:
""No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted," said the ancient Greek storyteller Aesop. Kindness is a huge part of life that makes us grow and have a good, loving, and kind heart. Every day we need to show kindness because we are helping people who have a bad day or are going through a rough time. I have been one of those people who are going through a rough time, and it's hard and sad. Last year at my old school (it was a private school), I was lost. The people that I trusted were fake, and their kindness was fake. I needed someone by my side, but they didn't care. The only thing that was important to them was themselves. They didn't care about other people's feelings, except for their best friend, which I was not a part of. They called me 'shy girl' because I was quiet. When you are new to a school, you get nervous, you feel you don't belong, and you say to yourself, 'This isn't my school.' Those were the exact same words in my head when I entered the building four years ago. I needed a true friend that was going to show me kindness, telling me that everything is going to be okay or 'I will always be by your side.' I cried every day for that matter. They judged a lot of people who were innocent by their looks or how they act. I felt alone. Until... 

The end of seventh grade I transferred to a public school, I felt alive. I never felt that feeling in years. The people were nice to me. I met so many nice people. I met real friends. They cared about me; they asked me if everything was okay, said 'You are beautiful,' 'You are amazing,' 'What's wrong?' 'How was your day?' 'This will make you feel better.' Everything they said was kind. It always made my day. I felt that I belonged here. I was so much happier, and I am still happy. Any people who do any kind or nice things to me, I appreciate it. 

Believe me, if you do any kind thing to someone or say something nice to them, it makes their day because they know they are not alone. 

Kindness may not be everywhere, but as long as you feel you belong or have a purpose in life, you have kindness in you, and the people around you do too. Whatever happens in life, you must have kindness in your heart because one day you will change someone's life just like a switch. Because if you don't turn on the switch, it stays dark, but when you turn on the switch, it is bright; it shines. That's how kindness works. If you help people to show kindness, they will bring kindness back. 

I hope people show kindness because they helped me, and I help them. Kindness, any little thing you do, is something that the people will always remember and cherish. The only thing I always remember and say is to always show kindness to the world. Show kindness and respect always. Maybe one day you will change someone's life. Showing kindness is the right thing to do. Always be kind.""

"Have you ever heard a saying from someone famous? If so, you might've heard one from Michelangelo. Michelangelo was a great artist who once said, "The greater danger for most of us lies not in setting our aim too high and falling short; but in setting our aim too low, and achieving our mark." I don't agree with this statement because the greatest danger lies in us setting our aim too high and falling short. The statement that Michelangelo made is negatively impactful because it can cause us stress and make us act negatively in different ways.

The greatest danger for most of us lies in setting our aim too high and falling short because of stress. By setting our aim too high, stress can make us feel like giving up on what we want to accomplish in our lives. If we do this, we will feel hopeless and not try again. Another reason why stress is related to this is because it can make us feel tired and lazy. If we become tired and lazy, it can make us overthink and have negative thoughts. These are the reasons and examples of what stress can do to us if we set our aim too high.

The greatest danger for most of us lies in setting our aim too high and falling short because it can make us act negatively in different ways. If we focus so much on setting our aim high, it can make us forget important stuff. For example, it can make us forget to have quality time with our family and friends. We would lose the connections with our family and friends if we are only focusing on one thing. Another reason is it can make us behave badly and forget our manners. For example, if we focus on setting our aim too high and spend so much time on it all day, it can ruin our sleeping schedule and cause us to act cranky. These are the reasons and examples of acting negatively in different ways if we are setting our aim too high and falling short.

Some people think the greater danger for most of us lies in setting our aim too low and achieving our mark. They think that because if we set our aim too low, we won't care as much about what we want to accomplish. For example, if we are just trying to rest or relax for a bit, they think we don't actually care about finishing our tasks. Another reason why they probably think that is because we won't be focusing on important things in life if we don't accomplish our goals first. For example, if we don't show the effort in front of them, they will automatically assume we don't show interest in accomplishing it and think we don't really care about what we want to do in life. Even though this may be true, I still think that the greater danger for us is setting our aim too high and falling short because it can cause more problems.

The statement that Michelangelo made is negatively impactful because it can cause us stress and make us act negatively in different ways. It can make us stressed if we set our aim too high and make us act negatively in different ways if we focus too much on setting our aim too high and falling short. By setting our aim too high, it can cause us to be stressed and make us feel like giving up and not wanting to finish our work. It can also make us stressed by not getting enough sleep if we're only focusing on one thing. These are the reasons why I disagree with Michelangelo because he believes that the greatest danger for most of us lies in setting our aim too low and achieving our mark."

Although some people think students should not take online classes, nevertheless, there are some who agree with this situation in education. This is because online classes are time-limited, so students can use their time wisely for other things, and for those who face transportation problems every morning, classes from home will make their life easier.

To begin, taking online classes from home is much more valuable because these classes are time-limited, allowing students to use their other time wisely. For example, online classes usually have sessions which are at fixed times. One course must be completed within that session time. In this case, students can plan their study time during the day and work a job in their free time. In the USA, most students have to take out loans to finish their education. So, doing a job while taking an online course will help a lot with those loan terms. Clearly, it is beneficial to take online classes and agree with the offer of distance learning.

Furthermore, for students who do not have their own transportation, online classes are the best option. For instance, in the USA, not having one's own transportation is a big problem. It is often the students who suffer the most. Every single morning, they have to rush for public transportation to get to campus so that they will not be late for class. Sometimes it affects their attendance, depending on the institute and their professors. This proves that taking an online class can solve most of these problems easily. And students will be able to focus on studying more than handling little problems like these, which are almost turning into a part of their daily life.

Overall, it is much more important that taking a class online saves time and allows students to do other jobs to earn enough, and offers them the opportunity to be on time when there is a possibility of being late to class only because of transportation problems. This shows that students should attend classes from home via online or video conferencing and accept the offer of distance learning."

Essay to score:
"Want to know how an act of kindness can have an impact on others? Just by asking people how they are doing. Here are other ways you can perform an act of kindness: asking someone how they are doing, inquiring about what they did today and how their day was, and asking someone what they are doing can make people happy, and people will like you more.

Helping people when they need your help is important. When someone drops something, you can help them pick it up and take it to them before they leave and forget the item. When someone makes a mess, you can help them clean up so they don't have to do it by themselves and feel bad about themselves. If someone gets hurt, you can take them to the hospital or help them put a band-aid on if they have a cut.

Acting nicely towards people can make them feel good and happy. If you let a classmate borrow a pencil, it can make them happy. Just by letting someone use your phone to call someone can be a good act of kindness. Even doing a favor for someone can be an act of kindness, like taking someone's dog for a walk, taking the milk out of the refrigerator, or making food for someone. It can be a good thing for them and make their day.

Now you know how to make someone's day. It can be a friend, neighbor, a sibling, or a teacher. Just by a little nice thing you can do, you can make someone very happy."

"Multiple Opinions

Asking someone for advice is a great idea because they may have an insightful answer that you never considered. For instance, if you doubt the accuracy of your work, have attempted to correct it multiple times, and still do not understand it, try discussing it with a classmate. Compare your approach and results with theirs to see if you arrive at the same conclusion. Seeking the perspectives of more than one person is beneficial; it allows you to identify errors and gain different strategies for finding solutions. It is always wise to ask for advice, as it helps you comprehend the diverse thought processes of others.

Soliciting multiple opinions can assist someone in making a more informed decision and in understanding different viewpoints. It enables you to consider perspectives that may not naturally occur to you. By receiving input, you gain insights into what others think, which can guide your own thoughts. Advice can be sought in various situations, whether you are stuck on a problem, choosing the best milk at the grocery store, or selecting an outfit for school. For example, if you are unsure about your clothing choice, you might ask a family member for their opinion on your current ensemble.

It is estimated that over 90% of people seek advice from others, which not only facilitates better communication but also allows for the sharing of strategies. These strategies can be applied in various contexts, helping you tackle problems you might not initially understand."

Essay to score:
"Distance learning from home presents benefits for students and their daily lives. In my opinion, as a student, this is a good idea because some students live on their own or they help with their parents' finances. On the other hand, students will become more familiar with technology, and almost all students have internet access at home, which would make things easier for them. However, some people disagree with this idea because some students are not familiar with technology and may not be able to have internet access. In these cases, the school and the government could support them with technology. Distance learning will build a better future for students and society.

Online classes will have a positive change in their daily lives. For example, the time that students use to prepare and when they take a bus to school, this time they can use to sleep more or even start the classes early. Some students already have a job to save money for college, so they will benefit more because they will have more time to manage their time to do homework and work, in this way they will be less stressed. This can also change their social interaction.

Therefore, their video conferencing classes will have more interaction with the teacher, and if the student needs help, then the teacher will have more time for them. On the other hand, the relationship between the student and their friends can improve; they can use the time after school to hang out and enjoy their free time, and at the same time, this benefits their classes because they don't get distracted during class. By the way, regular schools have alerts and they close the school.

The reason why regular schools lose so many classes is because of the weather, but online classes represent a better option because students can attend classes from home and they are safe; they don't have to be in a dangerous situation, like taking the bus when it is snowing. So, they can continue their classes like a regular day.

In conclusion, online classes represent a better option and offer more opportunities for those students who have to work and study at the same time. It is an easier way to reach their goals."

Essay to score:
"One way to have fun and learn is by doing science experiments. It's better to learn while having fun because the information will be more memorable. Science experiments are the best because they teach how to work as a team, work independently, and develop life skills.

Science experiments teach teamwork because teammates help each other out. Working on an experiment doesn't mean one teammate does all the work; there are roles for each team member. For a team to function well, someone must be in charge to assign roles so the experiment can proceed smoothly. If a team doesn't work together to achieve the goal of the experiment, then the science experiment wouldn't be as educational. Science experiments are enjoyable because students can work with their friends as a team to learn and have fun at the same time. If they have fun while doing an experiment, then they will most likely remember it.

Although science experiments teach teamwork, they also teach how to work independently. Some students might not feel comfortable working with teammates, so they work independently. Some also prefer to work independently rather than with a team for various reasons. One reason is differing opinions; when working with a team, the team members might not all agree with one another. Some students prefer to work alone because they can focus better. If they were in a team, then they might get stressed out because of peer pressure from teammates.

Life skills are another set of skills that science experiments teach. Whether a student is working with a team or independently, they learn life skills. Students in teams learn how to lead, command, and collaborate. They might not work with their friends, but when they are in a career, they might work with people they don't know, and that's what science experiments prepare them for. Students who work independently learn how to be more self-reliant and cautious.

Science experiments are an enjoyable learning tool. Students can have fun and learn at the same time, which is why science experiments are beneficial. Sometimes they might seem like they don't teach anything, but they do. Most of the time, they are memorable, which is the purpose of a science experiment."

Essay to score:
"In some schools, students have the option to engage in distance learning. Do you think students would benefit from being able to attend classes from home? I believe that there are benefits for students to be able to attend classes from home, as it provides extra time to work, and if students cannot go to school, they can still participate in class from home.

Some schools offer distance learning programs that allow students to attend classes from home, which is helpful for gaining additional time to work. For instance, in some classes, students are required to complete their work within a limited time, which can be stressful. However, distance learning programs can offer students enough time to work at their own pace.

In this world, every person has their own dreams for the future and an ideal way of life. For example, some aspire to be doctors, engineers, athletes, or astronauts. However, if you are not educated, it is challenging to achieve your dreams. If education is necessary to realize one's dreams, it is not possible for everyone to attend school due to various reasons, such as living far from school, lacking sufficient funds, having part-time jobs for sustenance, among other factors that can impede their aspirations.

On the other hand, students who participate in distance learning programs may find it more difficult to work on assignments and homework compared to those who can learn in school. This is because students at home do not have immediate access to teachers and classmates who can facilitate understanding through examples and explanations.

In my opinion, there are benefits for students to be able to attend classes from home, as it allows for extra time to work and provides an alternative for those who cannot attend school in person. In conclusion, having distance learning programs in schools is highly beneficial for students. Therefore, schools should offer distance learning as an option, enabling students to attend classes from home via online or video conferencing. Additionally, students should not give up if they cannot attend school in person, as they can opt for a distance learning program to make their dreams achievable. Schools should play their role in helping students realize their dreams."

"Do you think that community parks, state parks, and national parks provide a wide variety of fun and interesting activities? I believe that some parks offer activities that you can enjoy with your family. For instance, state parks often have engaging activities suitable for family enjoyment. Community parks may offer some interesting activities, but not all community parks are equipped with such options. Typically, community parks provide a space where everyone can visit and spend time with their family. National parks, on the other hand, not only have interesting and fun activities for families but may also offer special holiday activities that you and your family can participate in.

I think that community parks, state parks, and national parks can provide a wide variety of fun and interesting activities. For example, a national park might have activities that allow your children or the entire family to partake in, including holiday activities. State parks might offer family-friendly activities and could host events like a father and son competition, such as a fishing contest or a boat-building challenge, to test if the creations work and float on water. Community parks may host summer activities, such as a 'mud run,' where there are numerous activities to try, including a race through mud.

My first reason for believing in the value of community parks, state parks, and national parks is that they offer a range of activities, though this varies by park. A community park might have activities, or it might simply be a place where everyone can gather for a cookout, where you can take your kids to play, walk with your friends, or engage in sports like soccer or football. Community parks often have interesting summer activities for those looking for something to do.

My next reason is that community parks, state parks, and national parks offer different experiences. For instance, a community park is a place for fun and family time. A state park might offer interesting activities for families and children, and it could be a fun destination. State parks might also have holiday activities or simply serve as a place for families to spend time together and discover interesting activities. State parks often host cool and interesting activities in the summer that are enjoyable for friends, families, or children.

My final reason is that community parks, state parks, and national parks each offer unique experiences. A community park is a place for fun and family time. A state park may provide activities for children and families, while a national park offers a wide array of activities for families to try. National parks might also have holiday activities for children and families. In the summer, national parks are filled with activities that friends and families can enjoy, and the parks are often large enough to accommodate everyone participating in the activities.

In conclusion, community parks, state parks, and national parks each have their own unique offerings. While some may not have as many interesting activities, they all serve as places where people can go to have fun with their families. National parks, in particular, are known for their wide range of interesting and fun activities that can be enjoyed with friends and family, including during holidays."

Essay to score:
"Don't lose enthusiasm for your goals; failure is just a little bump down the road in life that teaches you how to do or make things better.

I personally agree with Winston Churchill's prompt, "Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm."

Therefore, many people fail on their way to reaching their goals, but by being persistent and not losing their enthusiasm, they will succeed.

Most people fail to succeed in their goals.

Every single person in this world has a goal, but most of them go through many tough times and failures before completing them.

For example, I failed my driver's license test three times; my goal was to pass it so I could start driving. So I did, but I failed a few times before completing my goal.

I felt like such a failure every time I didn't pass the test, but I did not give up. As a result, after studying day and night without giving up, I accomplished my goal. Failing to me is not the end of the world; it just motivates me to do things better every day.

A person must have love, passion, and enthusiasm to be successful.

Many people work hard and with passion in what they love the most. For instance, my stepfather, Generic_Name, a great businessman, faced total chaos when he started his company.

The company was not popular and was not selling products. Generic_Name went to bankruptcy once, but loving what he does and without giving up, he stood up to work hard to have a successful company.

IMPAK, his company, is now one of the most popular in selling plastic products in the United States.

Some would argue that you don't have to fail in order to be successful. On the other hand, 98% of successful people fail before reaching their main goal.

By doing what you love the most and not giving up on it, is the main key to success in life.

In brief, don't just give up on your goal just because you fail a few times. Complete them in order to be successful."

Essay to score:
"It has been a hard day at school, with everyone praying for the last bell of the day to ring.

Ring! Ring! Everyone rushes to the halls to get on their bus to go home. They think of all the things they can do when they get home, like flying a kite or playing football, not thinking about school in the slightest. Now, take one and a half hours of those students' free time away from them. This may become a reality if the school board gets their way.

If I asked students if they wanted one and a half hours added to their school day, most of them would say no. People's thoughts may vary when it comes to a topic like this. I would only approve one and a half hours being added if school gets a later start time. As a student myself, I would say that exercise is very important, but extending school time will take away from that time. Most high schools end at three o'clock; if the board adds one and a half hours, schools will end at four-thirty p.m.

This may be a good thing because students will have more time to learn instead of doing nothing. Some children are worse off than others; some are homeless and some are without parents. This would be a good time to learn so they could be better off. Parents that work nine-to-five jobs won't have to worry about leaving their child unsupervised. There will be increases in work ethic and discipline. Less homework will be assigned because the students will have more time in their classes.

The reason I disagree is because this would hurt not only the students but also the local government's economy and the taxpayers. If the teachers work more hours, then they will have to be paid more money. If the local government has to pay them more money, then they're going to tax more people. That means that their income tax will be higher. Taxpayers would boycott the additional tax that comes with the one and a half hour change.

This is why adding one and a half hours would not only hurt students but also the local government's economy and the taxpayers. In retrospect, the board should lay out a plan that works for students, parents, and the economy. There are some pros to this plan, but there are mostly cons. I hope the head of the board and members consider not enacting this time extension. These are my thoughts on the topic at hand."

This is especially true for those living in a different country or city, where being away from family can be tough because you need your family with you, and sometimes it is difficult for these students because they have nothing in the place they stay. Some students work because they want to, or they dislike staying at home, and they work for entertainment or simply because they want a cellphone. They work to buy the things they want.

"The best experiences for teenage students are at school. Schools offer fun activities for classes. Students can make so many friends when they are in school. Although some schools offer online schooling, being in school is probably the better choice because students won't slack off at home, and they can participate in more fun activities at school with friends.

Being homeschooled isn't the safest choice for a student. Students now will usually have a cell phone or some electronic device that could keep them distracted from taking their classes or doing their work. Cheating could also affect their careers because then they won't know the material for the bigger tests like the SOL and the SAT. Students might just slack off. Online classes probably won't teach them life lessons or offer fun activities.

Schools have so much more to offer than taking classes online at home. Students will always have help for questions at school, and they don't have to look it up. In schools, students can always make friends and participate in lots of activities with them. There is never cheating on any tests and quizzes.

Online testing isn't the best thing for students; it's probably less engaging for them. They won't have to wake up as early as regular students do when they have school. Their classes are shorter than those at regular schools. The best part is probably that they will always be at home.

Students will have the most benefits when they are at school and not at home taking online classes. Online classes can make students slack off and not do their work. In school, students will have friends and participate in fun activities. They will simply have the best experience when they are at school."

"It has been said that a positive attitude is the key to having a successful life. However, some may disagree due to their own opinions. I agree with this statement; I believe that the key to having a successful life is by maintaining a positive attitude.

Many people are often in a bad mood, which may convert into negative energy, thus forming a negative attitude. With a negative attitude, people seem not to care much about what they are doing and may not realize what they are capable of achieving in life. People with this negative attitude tend to get mad very easily and quickly. This affects them because they give up, and giving up so quickly and suddenly won't be beneficial for them; they won't be able to make it far in life. However, for people with a positive attitude, the result is very different. Those with a positive attitude most likely have a lot of energy within them, and with this energy, they can reach greater heights. People with a positive attitude don't give up easily, partly because of the energy they possess, but also because they tend to see something good in everything, like a positive result or a better outcome. Let's compare a person with a positive attitude versus a person with a negative attitude: if a person with a negative attitude plays the guitar for the first time and doesn't get it right, they will become frustrated with themselves and give up. In contrast, a person with a positive attitude won't give up after a couple of mistakes; they will keep going until they get it right, a result of always maintaining a positive point of view.

Having a positive attitude is beneficial; it affects you and others around you. You may not see it, but it's most likely true. In my opinion, a positive attitude is the key to having a successful life."

"People always say, 'Do that,' or 'Do this,' but you have the right to make your own decisions. I think people should trust their own decisions rather than having others tell them what to do. One reason I think it's better for you to make your own decisions is that you can do what you want to do without anyone telling you otherwise. Another reason is that you'll be able to build up confidence and won't be scared to speak up. What would you do: make your own decision or have others make it for you? I'm here to show you how it's better to make your own decision.

My first reason why I think it's better to make your own decisions is that you can do whatever you want to do. You don't have to listen to anyone else. If you want to go play soccer, football, baseball, or basketball, then do it; that's your decision. Don't go seeking guidance from someone else because they might tell you to do something that you don't want to do or something that you have already done before. But if you make your own decisions, you can do what best fits for you and no one else. You can learn and have fun by making your own decisions.

My other reason is that you'll be able to build up self-confidence and won't be scared to speak up. A lot of people are really scared or shy to speak up about what's on their mind, but I feel like if people would just make their own decisions, they wouldn't be scared or shy. However, if people let others make the decisions for them, they are always going to be scared to speak up. I know this because I was once shy; I would never speak up for myself and I would let people make decisions for me. But once I started making my own decisions, I felt my confidence boosting. Now I am not that shy anymore and I can make my own decisions.

A lot of people would disagree with me and say that it's better to seek guidance and that the guidance should make the decisions for us. They argue that experts know what's best for us because they have already done this before. So, they can give us really good tips to help us make it easier. They could be a really good help in making our decisions or just make them for us; that would help us in life. It would make us try new things out to see if we like them or not, and if we don't like it, we have to go seek some more guidance that would help us make our decisions.

I still think that it's better if you made your own decisions rather than having someone else do it for you. I gave you two reasons why I would make my own decisions, and I also showed you why people would rather have other people make their decisions for them. I hope this essay helps you in life to figure out if you should make your own decision or have someone else make it for you. Both sides could help you in your life, but I think making our own decisions is better, and that's my decision, no one else's."

They are an important asset to us because, without them, honestly, everyone could potentially be out of control; we need their help, and it's not wrong to need or ask for help. We can't just do whatever; we need help all the time, no matter how little of a thing it may seem. I don't think it's too wise to just let people do what they want because they feel like they don't need help or advice on something. Going off instinct or just your ideas isn't the way it should be. We don't know what kind of ideas some people may have.

People should be able to make their own choices, but a little bit of guidance when making the decision wouldn't hurt anyone. Sometimes you really do need the help, whether it's from your mom, a police officer, or a lawyer. Not everyone likes to seek help when they need to make a tough decision, and I get why it can be difficult asking others to get involved with the things we do. If we were to follow all our ideas and instincts, do you really believe this world would be the way it is right now? Probably not; we humans can make some really bad choices. Not everyone, but we have a good handful of people that don't care about what they do, say, or who they hurt. If everyone was just going off instinct, this world would definitely be messed up and all over the place; it'd be way more messed up than it already is. We are human; we can't go off whatever we feel is right in our minds because that could land you in trouble, and it may not even be worth it. Here is an example: in a TV show I watched not too long ago, this teenage girl took her life but didn't ask for help from anyone. She just wanted people to know she was upset, but who was going to know when she was carrying around a big smile? The point is that not every person has the mentality we all think; so differently and getting professional help from someone who sees or hears things like that we may feel or think is normal, and they can give us the answers we would never find on our own.

It's really important for everyone to understand that you can't just do whatever we please. There are consequences for absolutely everyone roaming around with wild ideas and thinking you can just do what your mind is telling you. For instance, would you feel comfortable knowing we just do whatever whenever because we don't have limits or rules, or would you like to see a friend fall because they put their pride over getting help? I sure would not enjoy seeing a close friend or family member getting dragged down because they were ignorant and decided not to look for help with their problems when they needed it the most.

In conclusion, I agree with seeking help from experts instead of having people go off what they think is right because I probably won't think the same things others do. I'd rather see people lining up to talk to someone about their problems, whether they be big or not. The ones who don't want help are the ones who just want to struggle on their own and fight it out. I ask for advice and opinions on a daily basis because it makes me feel better and more secure about my decisions, and I hope that's what others feel too. Asking for advice has never been a bad thing; everyone has your back if you need the help. Essay to score:
"First impressions are vital when meeting new people. Eye contact, manners, and conversational tone are all things that people tend to look for when involved in a first encounter. When meeting someone for the first time, you should always be on your best behavior and act with respect and dignity. Eye contact is very important to ensure that you are being attentive and are completely immersed in the conversation. While first impressions are important, they are not impossible to reverse if one does not go in your favor.

One can easily make a good first impression only to act disrespectfully later, which, in many cases, can overpower the good first impression. One can also make a not-so-great first impression but turn it around for the better. While it may be difficult to recover from a bad impression, it can be done. The idea of 'never judging a book by its cover' would appropriately fit this scenario. Since we are each our own individual character, we cannot immerse ourselves in the minds of others to truly understand what they are feeling or thinking. Many people may become nervous during the first impression, putting a void between eye contact and such.

Usually, one encounter with someone is not enough to judge them or to determine the kind of person someone is. Until a person is comfortable with their surroundings and the people around them, it is very possible that they may not act as friendly as they would in a situation when they are at ease. Furthermore, it is not an entirely fair assessment to judge a person without a few encounters.

It is wise never to judge someone based on their first impression; however, there are exceptions. If someone is cynical, sarcastic, rude, or arrogant during a first encounter, this may be typical behavior. Someone who attempts to belittle you or acts as if they are on a higher level is most likely always this way. A person who preoccupies themselves while in a conversation with things such as texting or listening to other things that are not a part of the conversation, or who interrupts, is most likely displaying their normal behavior. Doing such things is rude, disrespectful, and will be hard to recover from.

Even if some portray themselves to be rude individuals, a judgment should not be made based on one single encounter. People should be given more than one chance to display themselves as they truly are. Judgments should be made after a few, lengthy encounters to ensure that true character is shown. Give everyone a few opportunities to prove themselves as good-minded individuals."

"Is it a good idea to make high school three years instead of four?

Some people follow the traditional four-year course to finish high school, but others opt for an accelerated three-year program. They take additional classes during summer or vacations as a pastime to get ahead, or to complete their education sooner. This can be beneficial as it helps individuals to advance and continue on to college for a better job or life. However, some people who come to South or North America may need an extra one or two years to finish high school due to the language barrier with English. Therefore, it is a good idea to continue classes and finish for a brighter future, start college, and enter the workforce. But life is not always good and easy, and often requires self-reliance and the support of others, so one must always strive.

When you accelerate your classes and finish high school in less than four years, you are prepared for college. With an extra year, you can work to save money and use it to pay for college classes or to get ahead academically. However, during this time, you need to stay focused because you have to finish your education and start a career, making the most of this time for a better life for yourself and your family. But remember, nothing comes easily; it takes effort and support from family and friends.

You can get a job and earn money for college, paying for your classes. Some may dismiss this as mere pocket change, but once you graduate from college and secure a good job, you can recover all the money spent and more, and use it for yourself and your family. It's important to look to the future, considering needs like a car, a home, and savings. When you're older, you'll want to enjoy life, rest, and be surrounded by loved ones, whether that's family, friends, or pets. The key is to feel content with your choices.

After finishing high school or college and securing a good job, you can have a fulfilling life with your family and friends, enjoying your earnings, traveling, and experiencing the world. Enjoy your retirement and the rewards of your studies and work for a prosperous life, and remember those who have supported you along the way.

Some advocate for the traditional four-year high school experience, while others promote the faster three-year track, using the extra year to work or advance in college. After completing your career, you can rest and enjoy life. It's important to consider what's best for your life and future, thinking about how you want to live and what your goals are.

Use your time wisely, focusing on your future. Celebrate and enjoy life after achieving your goals. Study diligently, whether during vacations or the school year, and don't waste time.

Sometimes you may not pass all classes or master every subject, but with focus and determination, you can achieve something in life, secure a good job, or buy a home where you can rest. A good life with family and friends who are there for you requires focus on your life, a good job, and a loving family. Consider how you want to spend the precious three or four years of high school and whether to continue on to college or enter the workforce.

Use the time you need; there's no need to rush. Take all the time necessary to achieve your goals in life. Enjoy your summer vacations, knowing that once you're finished, the reward will be great, and then you'll have plenty of free time."

Essay to score:
""You smell," is what honesty sounds like, and "You smell good," is what not being honest sounds like. Now, which one sounds better? Being honest can be very hurtful in many ways. A reason for someone not to be honest is for being a good friend or supporter. Giving your honest opinion could help, as well as giving your not so honest opinion.

Not being honest can be very helpful in many situations. One of them is being a parent. A parent can't always be honest with their kid. If their kid dresses up like a character, the parent can't say they look bad. They have to say they look like the character they dressed up as. Another reason for someone not to be honest is going out with friends or couples. Even if they don't look the best, you have to compliment them nicely.

Others may say that being honest can help others to become, or do something better. Many friends want the honest opinion from others, and that may help them. Maybe the outfit doesn't match, or something is wrong with the way they dress. Being honest can prevent someone from being embarrassed later on. If a person's favorite cartoon character is showing? Someone has to be honest and tell that person what's going on before others see the problem. An example of being honest is a therapist. A therapist 'has' to be honest; that's why they get paid. Therapists tell their patients their honest opinion, and their honest opinion on what the problem is.

There are many problems in life when someone needs your honest opinion. Being honest can help others do better, and not being honest can help protect someone's feelings. In general, both being and not being honest can be very helpful with feelings, problems, and solutions. Which one would you choose, honesty, or protecting someone from being hurt?"

Sincerely,

Essay to score:
"One of Ralph Waldo Emerson's most famous quotes is, "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." Some people think that being something else in this world is an accomplishment. They feel that change is a good way to succeed in life. I agree with the quote; I believe that to be myself in a world that is constantly trying to make me something else is the greatest accomplishment, and this is true because being yourself helps you to be honest, to be more secure in who you are, and people love you because you show your true self and are not trying to be someone else.

Firstly, I believe being honest all the time is synonymous with being yourself, and honesty enables you to be true to your identity. Being honest is beneficial because people trust your words, and if you are doing something good, others are likely to follow suit. Some people constantly lie to impress others and to appear as someone they are not, which is not good because every lie will ultimately affect your life. I think if people really like being around you, they will accept your mistakes. It is like when you are getting to know someone and you tell them about yourself.

Secondly, being secure in who you are means being yourself. People think that changing who they are will alter the past, what they did, or how they appeared before. They believe that by changing their appearance, they can change the way they treated people, but many change because someone hurt them and they don't want to revisit a past filled with bad memories. Others love themselves as they are and don't want to change anything because they feel secure.

Lastly, people will love you for being yourself and not trying to be something else. People treat you based on how you present yourself. If you are genuine with others, they will not doubt you. People love those who show their true selves, how they genuinely treat others, or how they truly act. When you don't show your true self, others may think you are lying, even if you are telling the truth. However, when you are being yourself and telling the truth, they will have more confidence in you.

As you have read, I agree with the quote because that's the way I think. I feel that being yourself in a world that tries to make you something else is an accomplishment. Often, many people think they want change, but for the better. People hurt you in life, and you change because of them; they make you stronger. I believe that not changing is a good way to feel satisfied with what you did right in the past, and that is why being yourself is an accomplishment."

A survey shows that after their graduation, the majority of students don't know what to do with their lives. In high school, students don't have enough maturity to make important decisions and consequently, they don't know what to do. It is a fact that high school is not an easy stage; for that reason, students cannot possibly finish their education earlier. They have to do the work of four years in three, which means that they have to attend summer school, stay after school, go to night school, and consider other options. They have a lot of work to do; therefore, they are not going to have much time for other things, like having a job or just having free time. If students are constantly under pressure, they are going to suffer from stress. Stress is a real problem that always affects students and their grades; with stress, they cannot have a relaxed life and peace with themselves. Early graduation is a difficult and unnecessary process because it doesn't give the student the chance to acquire enough maturity for real life, it gives them too much work to do in less time, and it causes them stress.

The normal four years in high school give the student the chance to acquire enough maturity for real life. This time helps students to grow up, physically and mentally, and to develop their perspective on life. During this time, they can understand what they want in the future, what is right and what is wrong, what their abilities are, and how they are going to develop their skills in the real world. At this stage, they are still young and the majority have no idea what they want to be when they become adults. After high school, they have to start their life, a real life, because they have to be independent; they are no longer children. They have to make really important decisions, like whether they want to go to college, get a job, or be President of the United States. Students have to think about the future; they have to know which path they want to take. It is a very difficult task to decide what you are going to be for the rest of your life when you are still an adolescent, and if you have to make this decision earlier than normal, it is even more difficult because it is easy to dream, but students also have to be realistic about their options. Of course, the aim of education is to help students discover who they really are, and it depends on the students to take everything learned during their education and put it into practice after high school, in their new life.

The majority of students decide not to finish high school early because it is not an easy task; you have to do the same work as in four years, but with less time, and that is more stressful because it can be too much. Students claim that if you decide to graduate early, you have to work day and night without a break. You have to continue working on important days like holidays; yes, no vacations if you want to finish early. As Frida Kahlo once said, "Life isn't a race; there is time for everything." If a student has the chance to finish school in four years, what is the hurry? Why rush through school if this is the most important time in the life of each student, where you find yourself? It is not a good idea to be burdened with a lot of homework, tests, projects, and many other things; that is too much, it is not necessary to suffer that. Students have to live in the moment; they just have to enjoy each stage of life, the good, learn from the mistakes, and live life. If students are always working on school, how are they going to have a job in the afternoons to earn extra money for the things they want, or how are they going to have fun with their family and friends if they don't have time to be free, to be adolescents? School is not a race; there is enough time to go step by step.

Researchers believe that one of the most important and worrying problems that adolescents face is stress. Stress can lead to several consequences in their lives, such as nutritional problems, sleep deficiency, being angry or tired all the time, and in extreme cases, stress can lead students to suicide. It is not normal for students to suffer from stress. They should not have to handle high amounts of work; they should follow the normal process if they want. Students have to proceed at their own pace, they have to learn that it's fine to go slow. Just ensure that they enjoy school because studying and learning new things should be interesting and fun, not something that destroys your life.

For these reasons, programs that allow high school students to graduate early can affect more than improve the lives of students. The duty of a high school student, of course, is to succeed in their learning and develop their skills in the best way they can. But their duty is also to enjoy their youth; they are not adults yet, that's why they can and should have time to have fun, to make memories with the people they love. They do not have to start before it's time, and take important decisions that will mark their whole life if they are not ready to do so. They also cannot live with the stress that is a consequence of having too much homework to do. School is one of the most important things in the world, but there has to be a balance, and schoolwork cannot be all that you have to do at that stage. Now you know, life isn't a race; there is time to do everything. You can take your time, make mistakes, start again, learn many things. You can do whatever you want because you have time, but you only have one life."

Negative people also know that it is easier to work with a group of people who have a positive attitude.

People with a good attitude are better team leaders as well, because they have more patience to explain or teach others.

Keeping a positive mind is definitely the key to making an effort to accomplish things and complete your goals.

"Thomas Jefferson wrote, 'Never set our goals low, because it is amazing to see what we can achieve if the goals are higher.' I also believe that as long as we try our best and do something to accomplish it, we can succeed.

People do not know their limits. We do not know how much we can accomplish if we do not try. For example, my friend Generic_Name played basketball and she was good at it. However, whenever our coach asked her to enter the state game, she always made some excuse not to enter. One day, our coach called her and told her that he was scared to enter the state game too. He said we will never know our limits until we push them. Another example is my friend's sister, Generic_Name, who is a great artist. She never sold her work because she thought no one would buy it. Then one day, she uploaded some of her art pieces on a selling website. Not only did they get sold, but she also got a job because of it.

As a kid, we all learned to never give up. In school, every kid has been told to follow their dreams, to do what they like, or to never stop following their dreams. For example, I love to draw, and when I took art in school, I was disappointed with my work after seeing other students' artwork. After a few weeks, I decided to drop my art class. When I told this to my art teacher, she told me to never compare myself to others; learn to look at where you started, what you have achieved, and what more you have to accomplish. In my gym class, I could not run for more than five minutes. One day, my teacher told me to run ten minutes without stopping. It seemed impossible, but after days of practicing by walking one mile every day, I did it. Then, my teacher told me there is no limit to how much you can achieve as long as you try your best to accomplish it.

Although some people think doing something small for our accomplishments does not help at all, I believe every step we take towards our goals, no matter how huge or little, always serves a purpose.

Life is like a game; every level will teach you something, no matter what it is."

"My topic is about conserving energy and resources. Some businesses have adopted a four-day workweek, with each day consisting of ten hours. Should your school follow this model by extending the school day by 2 hours more every day?

Many businesses have switched over to a four-day workweek.

For many, this is a great thing, and for others, not so much. How does this affect schools around the world if they were to adopt this method? In this essay, I will be talking about the pros and cons of this subject involving school scheduling, cost, transportation, and how it can benefit or not be feasible to have a four-day school week.

To start, having fewer days of school can improve attendance. With fewer days to miss, students are more likely to have better attendance and be more motivated since they have time to rest and prepare. Some studies have been done, and they showed that attendance has improved by twenty percent in a two-year period.

If you only have a four-day school week, that means the amount of work assigned is less, so more students will be able to turn their assignments in on time. The same thing would go for teachers; since the workweek is shorter, they have more time to prepare and time to organize things to be ready when the week starts.

Another thing is that since the workweek is shorter for teachers, it gives them more time to do other work and not have to work over the weekend, as some do sometimes, and students can attend other school activities during that day off.

When it comes to cost, this can make a significant change. Energy will be saved since the school will not be running the full five-day week.

Overall, I believe having a four-day school week would be more beneficial in the long run. More students would be motivated to attend school, and teachers' lives would be less stressful. I am for this to happen and feel that many other students would say the same; a four-day school week would make life easier and a better place to learn.

My conclusion is that it is better if the students and teachers have a four-day school week because they can have time to do other things and work better. But the most important thing is that they can enjoy school."

Extracurricular activities are not a good choice because many students don't like going to school and don't enjoy participating in activities. The principal has decided that all students must participate in at least one extracurricular activity. I disagree with his decision because most students will not want to participate in an activity. The principal made that rule, but the students who don't want to do it will get in trouble. Getting into too much trouble can affect their lives and also their grades. Students should have the right to choose what they want and what they don't want because it would not be fair. For example, students need to stay after school for an activity, but they couldn't go. Extracurricular activities are great sometimes because you have more time to hang out with your friends and such, but when they don't let you, that's when students get mad. I would not join an activity because when I get home, I don't have time to do all my stuff at home. Students get annoyed when teachers tell them to do something they don't want to.

All the schools in Generic City have good and bad rules. They don't let you do what you want to do, and sometimes you get in trouble for not going to your activities. Students often don't have time for activities, or they don't find them important. Also, they can be scared to go because they're afraid of being bullied by someone. There are many reasons why students should not be forced to participate in activities. If a student picks a sport like soccer, they can get hurt in many ways, as in other sports. People get bored when they're just sitting there listening to the teacher. They can also get distracted easily and then get in trouble for talking. The teachers can also be too much; they get mad if you're chewing gum in class and then they're like, "I'M GOING TO GIVE YOU A REFERRAL FOR CHEWING GUM."

Teachers could create some other fun activities so students can enjoy their time with their friends. Some students can be too lazy to even think about doing activities. The county should create more exciting activities so students can go and learn more, helping them understand that maybe activities are not that bad. Students may look like they're distracted, but maybe they're not; maybe it's because they don't know how to do something in the activity. That's why I wouldn't agree with this decision that the principal made."

Essay to score:
"In some societies, students are expected to identify a career by the time they enter high school. Not only that, but they are also expected to commit to a specific career at a young age. This issue with young students committing to a specific career is not a good idea, nor is it fair. There are many reasons why this approach is unfair.

For example, it's not fair to expect a young student to make a definitive decision on a career when there is so much more they could explore instead of setting their mind on one specific topic. They may not be interested in it when there are so many other opportunities from which to choose.

Committing to one specific career is not at all easy, especially when you know there are so many other opportunities out there that you might like and want to pursue. But because you enjoy it when you're young, you really have no clue which career will best suit you.

After you choose a career, then comes the commitment to the classes and other subjects.

Another reason this is a bad idea is that these young students have to pick a career at a young age. They also have to keep in mind what their classes will be about and how this will guide them toward their career. Another thing is that these young minds will be overwhelmed by all the work they will have to do during their classes.

Another problem would be the amount of stress they will be put under, as well as the amount of homework they will be given and the time they will have to complete it. It will be a big stress for the young students.

Furthermore, young students will have a difficult time deciding whether or not they made the right call on what career they picked. Having to make a significant decision on what career best suits you isn't at all easy; it makes you overthink your choice and how hard it will be, and so on.

Then, you will start to question whether or not you really want to pick that one career, or if there will be more along the way that are better suited to your interests, and you will know when you find that one career that really catches your eye later on when you know what path to take.

In conclusion, committing to a career at a young age isn't a great idea. After putting all this thought into this decision, it's best to say that it's a bad decision in the matter. For these reasons, not only do you have to think about how hard it is to pick a good career, but also about the career and the path you will be taking. Not only that, but also whether this career suits you in the best way, and consider the outcome of it all. This will always have a big effect on life because you're debating whether or not to follow the path or to give up and not try because the path you chose wasn't the right choice. In other words, I feel that it would be a bad idea to commit to a career at a young age, not knowing what the ultimate outcome of it all will be."
