"Parks

Community parks, state parks, and national parks often provide a variety of interesting activities. Some of these interesting activities include a play area, hiking, and skydiving. Most of these activities are somewhat common in most parks.

One of the interesting activities I listed is play areas, or also called playgrounds. They're mainly used by children under the age of 12, but they're useful in some ways, especially if you don't want to watch over your kids. You can just go to the nearest park and leave them there playing while you sit in a chair doing nothing. Why is this activity so enjoyable? Well, because it's where kids can go outside and spend some free time with other kids, and they could possibly find a new friend to play with. It's also healthy for the child; he can get some exercise.

The other activity I mentioned was hiking. Community parks don't have hiking spots; however, state and national parks do have some hiking spots. Hiking is fun; it's a way to have a fun time with nature, but sometimes you might encounter an animal that could harm you, like a grizzly bear or a rattlesnake. It could be a bad day for you, but usually, you don't, so most of the time it'll be a golden experience.

The last activity I mentioned was skydiving. It looks scary, but when you get used to it, it's pretty cool. Many people enjoy skydiving because it feels like you're flying, and plus, it takes a lot of courage to go skydiving. Skydiving is a great activity if you're not scared of heights; otherwise, it's not going to be good for you.

Overall, these activities I just mentioned are pretty great for parks, mostly national parks, but also good in community and state parks. Playgrounds are great for children but not for teens. Hiking is great if you want to see what nature has in store for you, but not great if you encounter a grizzly bear. Skydiving is also great for people who have the courage to skydive. In conclusion, these activities are enjoyable for most people."

Otherwise, you might find yourself alone, which can lead to feelings of regret for not having been kinder. A lack of kindness can result in others harboring resentment towards you, speaking ill of you, and ultimately isolating you. This can lead to anger and self-loathing for not having done the right thing, and as a result, more people may dislike you. On the other hand, showing kindness can earn you love and respect for being a good person, making both you and others happy. Failing to do so can leave you in a difficult situation, which is undesirable. Without kindness, people might perform tasks poorly out of spite, causing frustration. This can extend to loved ones, potentially leading to estrangement and the loss of family, possessions, and friends. In extreme despair, one might wish for their own end. Therefore, it is sometimes necessary to show kindness to avoid such dire outcomes. Now that you understand the potential repercussions, it is clear that showing kindness is essential."

Most students don't put in as much effort as others do, and that's because they don't care as much. If they aren't going to care enough about school, then what's the point of making them do extracurricular activities when you know they wouldn't put in the work for it? Students and families should be able to decide whether or not to participate in extracurricular activities because many students have jobs, they need time to do homework and study, and they should be able to enjoy their school years however they want to.

Students who have jobs aren't able to participate in extracurricular activities; they don't have the time for it. Most students need the job to save up for college, a car, and to help their families out. Making them do an activity for school would only put them under so much stress. Not only do they have to worry about college, a car, and helping their families, but they also have to worry about extracurricular activities. It wouldn't be fair to those who have a job; they are too young to be stressed out this much.

A reason why a good number of students have bad grades is that they can't do so many things at once. They lose track of time and end up having no time to do homework and study. Others just lose motivation to do anything after a long day of being busy and decide to procrastinate, which isn't good.

You only get to be a kid and a teenager once; we should be able to enjoy these years however we feel is best for us. We aren't in school forever, and if schools were to control what extracurricular activities we did, there wouldn't be any fun in that. What if they chose something we really dislike? Essay to score:
"Cell Phones

I believe the principal should not allow students to have phones at school at all. I feel this is a better decision than permitting students to bring phones to school and use them during lunch periods and other free times. My opinion is based on the potential negative impact on students' learning and education. For example, a student was texting another about an incident at a different school. She relayed what happened but couldn't share everything because she had to attend class. Unfortunately, it was a day when a crucial lesson was taught, yet the student was distracted, wondering about the rest of the story instead of focusing on the lesson. Consequently, when she took a test that included questions from that lesson, she failed.

The other student, who was in class while texting, also failed to pay attention. Her distraction not only affected her own learning but potentially the education of others around her, as she too failed a test on an important topic covered that day. This illustrates why it is vital to prohibit students from bringing phones to school. Moreover, phones can be a source of disturbance; for instance, if a student forgets to silence their phone and it rings suddenly, it can disrupt the entire class and impede learning.

I also believe that the rule 'Phones are not allowed in school' should be implemented in all schools. Students should never bring their phones to school. In my view, this would be the best policy for all educational institutions."

"Education is an essential part of your life and also an opportunity to have your dream job in the future. It is really important to attend school to receive an education, but there are many reasons to be absent from school. For example, for some people, it is difficult to attend class because maybe they missed the school bus and they do not have transportation, or they could have a part-time job that wears them out, making it hard to be ready for the next day of school. Additionally, the weather can be in extremely bad conditions, and it is dangerous to be outside, so you can stay safe at home.

Nevertheless, there are also many options for not missing the content of the school classes because you can attend classes from home via video conferencing or online. This is a good benefit for you because you can stay at home and at the same time be able to keep on track with your studies. However, it also has disadvantages because not everyone has an internet connection at home, which makes it kind of impossible to attend classes from home. Also, you can get confused with a topic, and if you have questions, your teacher might not be available at that precise moment to solve them, so you will have to wait until the teacher can be available again.

There are more disadvantages, for example, you cannot enjoy the activities that the school organizes or the field trips that the school plans. You could not spend time with friends and also with your teachers, and you could not contribute to school activities or be in clubs or sports teams of the school. Those are activities that students who attend classes online from home might not be able to participate in.

Above all, the disadvantage of attending classes at home, there are the same benefits that going to a regular school offers you, but with a different method of learning.

In conclusion, there are many ways to continue school even if you stay at home through an online site. Of course, there will be disadvantages, but you can always see the benefit of that, and you have to make more effort than normal to learn new things. I think distance learning is a good choice because it has almost the same benefits as going to school, but instead, you are staying at home."

I agree with Churchill's statement because most of the time it is hard to make our dreams come true, but if we really want to do something, we can do it, because everything is possible in life. For example, my biggest dream many years ago was to learn how to draw. I always dreamed of being someone who could create art from anything. But there were many reasons that almost made me forget about that dream. Another reason why I think that failure could lead us to the best things in life is because if we don't try, we will never know if it could be possible. Also, failure is not something that we should be afraid of; I think that failure can give us experiences in life that can lead us to success, things and experiences that only life can offer us.

Failure in life, for me, is just another opportunity to try something again but with the same or more enthusiasm. For example, when I started learning how to draw or paint, there were many reasons that almost made me forget about my dream. One of the main reasons was that I didn't have enough materials to make a simple piece of art; it was hard for me because in my country I didn't have the same opportunities that I have now. And I went from failure to failure, but I always tried to forget about negative things and I was just focused on being someone different in life. Now that I'm better at drawing and also have the materials that I always wanted, I'll keep getting better and I can say that it wasn't easy, but it was worth it. I know that I still have a lot to learn; I'll keep following my dream, and I know that one day I'll say, 'I FINALLY DID IT.'

Another reason why I agree with Churchill's statement is that most of the time we don't see what we have until it's gone. And failure can lead us to success because it can give us experiences that only life can offer. For example, if we do something wrong, we know that we won't be able to fix the past, but the only thing that we can do is to learn from our mistakes and try to be better in the future. And that is why I think that failure can lead us to success because if we don't know how hard it is to obtain something important in life, we will never appreciate what we have or what a person is doing for us. And it is very hard to imagine something that we haven't experienced; it's hard to try and learn from what we hear than learn from what we have been through. That is why we shouldn't be afraid to do something or to try new things in life because nobody was born knowing things; only life can give us the knowledge to learn and teach.

We shouldn't be afraid of falling through because life is about doing new things every day. Life is about living the way we want, having in mind that nobody is perfect and it's fine to make mistakes, but we have to learn from them. For example, many years ago I was afraid to leave my country; for many reasons, I thought that I wouldn't make it. But my main motivation to come to this country was to see my father for the first time after 18 years. I was scared to fail, but at the same time, I saw that opportunity as the greatest thing that I ever had. That's another reason why I agree with the statement because, like all the rest of the people, I'm not perfect. But I'm proud of some of the decisions that I have made in the past, and at the same time, I learned from my mistakes and I'll keep learning.

The hardest things in life are the things that will always be worth it. I share Churchill's idea because you have to suffer before you triumph. Everybody can try and teach you something, but your best teacher will always be life. To fall through is not a defeat; it's a new opportunity to do something better. And it's fine to fail in order to find success; we just have to stand up and try again but with the same or more enthusiasm."

"Should schools extend by two more hours to better serve students' needs?

The manager of the company 'SaleHouses' believes it is a great idea to add two more hours to the workday because the employees agree with this approach. After implementing this change, the company has become more effective, resulting in greater benefits and attracting a larger clientele. Additionally, he suggests that schools should adopt this method, saying, "I believe the schools can improve their academic averages." This method could significantly help students as they would learn and understand the material much better. It also benefits students who work on weekends, as they can complete their homework on Friday and then work calmly on Saturday and Sunday.

Firstly, extending the school day by two hours is beneficial because students can learn and understand the material much better. For instance, all the students in the English 11 class at Generic_School are achieving better grades since the school added two more hours. Clearly, the students are more engaged in English 11 and their comprehension has improved. As a result, the students in English 11 are receiving good grades, and the school's overall average is rising. This new method helps students to focus more and benefits schools by improving their averages.

Secondly, an extended school day is advantageous for students who work on weekends. For example, my friend Generic_Name, a seventeen-year-old who works at a restaurant called 'Brickhouse,' is comfortable with his schedule because the extra school hours provide him with more time, allowing him to work on Saturdays and Sundays. He has Fridays off to do his homework. As a result, Generic_Name has sufficient time for his activities and benefits from the school adding two more hours because he can complete his homework on Friday and work more calmly over the weekend. This arrangement benefits students who work on weekends by giving them enough time to complete their homework.

On the other hand, some people argue that adding two more hours is not a good idea because students might fall asleep in class due to the extended time in school, and it could affect teachers who live far away. Additionally, they fear this new method could lead to increased school dropout rates. These individuals disagree with the proposed change. However, they are mistaken, as this extension would help both students and schools. As a result, students would learn and understand the material much better, and those who work on weekends would benefit as well.

In conclusion, adding two more hours to the school day has both benefits and disadvantages. Some argue that it is not a good idea because it could cause students to fall asleep during class, affect teachers who commute from afar, and potentially lead to higher dropout rates. However, others believe that extending the school day by two hours is a great idea because it helps students learn and understand better, benefits those who work on weekends, and contributes to improving the school's academic average."

"The school should extend the school day by two hours. If that happened, it could have positive effects on the students' work. First, the students would have more free time. Second, they would be recharged with energy for the next day. Also, that would help them learn how to manage their time when they are working.

The students would have ample time to do what they love and want. Also, they could have more fun with their families. If the student arrives home earlier, he can take a rest during that time by sleeping, eating, or chatting with his friends. He can also engage in his favorite activities, like practicing his hobbies or going out with his family. For example, my sister likes to dance ballet in her free time, but she doesn't have time after school. So, she practices at night or on the weekend. In addition, many parents cancel their appointments or picnics because their children have school at that time. So, the parents will go out without their children, but in their hearts, they have big hopes to take them to create new memories together.

A shorter school day can help students have the energy to continue the day. In many cities, the school day is too long for students. When they arrive home, they can't move because they are tired. First, they wake up early at 7:00 AM and wait for the school bus until 7:40 AM. Second, they have more than four subjects in the day, all of which are hard enough to exhaust their minds and make them tired. Also, the school day ends at 3:00 PM. Most of the students feel like they are in jail, not a school. So, how can students continue their day with such low energy?

A shorter school day can help students learn to manage their time, especially when they study and work simultaneously. Some students work after school to save money for their college costs. If the school day were shorter, they could rest before working and spend time with their families or use this time for homework. In my class last year, there was a boy who worked after school until midnight. So, our teacher asked him, "Why didn't you do your homework?" He answered that he didn't have enough time to do it because he had to work to save money for his college and to support his family. He could have done his homework if he had more time after school.

For these reasons, the school day should be made shorter by extending it by two hours. It can help them earn more time for their favorite activities. Also, it helps them to have more energy to continue the day. In the end, they can balance their day between studying, working, and resting."

"The human being is fascinating. We have scientists, doctors, firemen, pilots, policemen, chefs, etc. There are some people who are always trying to do their best in order to improve our society, and every day new people are born to live in the world they are creating. Just like everybody else, they will start from zero and the same question will appear in their minds when they grow up, "What do I have to do to get what I want?

We grow up seeing and hearing different events that happen around the world, but also, at the same time, these events start to give form to our thoughts. All these factors make us think about our own future and also motivate us to start making decisions that will affect our lives.

What is the problem with all this? You might be wondering. As I said before, most people don't know what to do to get what they want. Once they've grown, sometimes people don't know which decisions they should make in order to have a pleasant life. This is when they start to ask themselves if they should ask for help or do it all on their own.

I've seen this situation a long time ago. I still remember when Generic_Name, my older brother, told me he had decided to be a doctor. He graduated from high school and was ready to take the next step in his life, work as a doctor, and be successful. My family and I were wondering which college Generic_Name had chosen, so he could learn everything a doctor needs to know.

When the time came and my mother asked him which college he had chosen, he said that he was not going to study at any college because he was going to learn all by himself. My mother was furious but she let him do it; she knew he was going to realize sooner or later that it was a big mistake.

My older brother has always been like that; he would try to do everything by himself, following his instincts and doing what he thought was right, until that day. One year had passed and Generic_Name hadn't made any progress. He saw how all his friends were learning how to be doctors in college while he was wasting his time reading books and articles on the internet, which was good but not good enough. His friends always told him that he had to go to college if he really wanted to be a doctor, but he didn't listen just because he thought he would spend years of his life by going; he thought that he could become a doctor faster in his own way.

Time passed, and he never made it; he never could be a doctor. His friends were making progress until they finally made it; they graduated while my older brother, through the years, never changed his attitude and decided to take a different direction in his life. Today, there are some occasions where he tells me how much he regrets his attitude back in those days.

With this story, I just want to make something clear: the fact that we can lose all our dreams, what we have always wanted, just by being obstinate, thinking that we are always right. I'm not saying that you, a person, cannot be successful by doing and learning everything by yourself. Of course, there are ways to do it, but are you really sure you can do it? Because making sure of who you are and what type of capacities you have is what will decide how well you will do it by yourself.

Anyhow, it is also important to know that asking for or looking for help will never be something bad. There are people with tons of experience in this world who can teach us how to be an excellent person; they can teach us how to be the person we want to be. No one has to learn or make decisions by themselves because there will always be somebody."

Essay to score:
"I don't agree with the principal's decision, and here is my reason. First, we shouldn't have to participate if we don't want to.

Second, we can make our own decisions instead of having an adult make them for us. For example, if someone does something without your permission, they are making decisions for you. However, if that person asks, 'Hey, there's a really cool sale on hoodies, and they want to ship the first hoodie for free. I just want to know if you're okay with me telling them your address.' If you say no, you are making the decision not to share your address. The same principle applies to school. If an adult tells you to do something you don't want to do, then don't do it and don't listen to them, unless it's beneficial for what you need to do.

Since our principal made the decision that all students should participate in at least one extracurricular activity, he or she is, in a way, forcing us to stay after school and do things other than our homework or projects. Some students play sports outside of school. For instance, if I had to stay after school for an activity, I might miss my football game this Friday or Saturday. Missing it could jeopardize my chance of demonstrating my abilities to the coaches.

Because of this, I might not be able to join an outside football team. There are times when you have to listen and do what you're told.

Even though I'm not fond of people making decisions for me, since the principal has decided we must stay after school for an extracurricular activity, we might as well do it. I can engage in an activity until I completely lose interest in the subject. Since it's only one activity, how hard can it be? However, my stance remains: I disagree with the principal about staying after school for an extracurricular activity. Some students might think, 'Oh well, I need to stay after school to get my grades up,' but the only club that might help with grades is the homework club, which is for people with a lot of homework. Since that isn't considered an extracurricular activity by the principal, you might as well stay after school and go to that club either way."

Essay to score:
"Schools should let students learn for 10 hours across 4 days. I agree that having an extended school day would provide students with more learning time and longer weekends to recover. However, they might struggle to find time for personal activities.

One reason why schools should extend the school day is that it would allow students to learn more in their classes. With longer class periods, students would have less homework, as they could complete more work during class time. Teachers could review units more thoroughly, ensuring students understand the material better. Schools would not fall behind in teaching; instead, they would be ahead. Longer class times would also mean more hands-on activities in subjects like science. Students with limited class time often struggle on test days, only grasping the main points of the units. Extended days with more class time would allow for teaching all the points in depth.

A second reason why having an extended school day for four days is beneficial is that students would enjoy a longer weekend. They could sleep in on Friday mornings without the worry of going to school. During the extended weekend, both students and teachers could spend more time with their families. Students would also have time to engage in sports or other active pursuits. With a three-day weekend, there's even the possibility of going on a short vacation. The break would help them recover from the week's stress, including tests and homework. Additionally, students could catch up on schoolwork if they missed a day, using the weekend to their advantage. Teenagers old enough to work could do so on weekends.

A third point to consider is that although students would spend more time in school, they might not have enough personal time. Sports and part-time jobs could suffer during the week. High school students who prefer to work might consider dropping out due to the increased stress, potentially leading to a decline in their grades. With such a tight schedule, some might prefer to skip school altogether. Younger children in elementary school could become exhausted with the early starts and late pickups; it is not ideal to force them to learn for so many hours.

Teaching and learning for 10 hours over 4 days, followed by a long weekend for students and staff, is an idea worth considering. I agree that a longer school day and weekend could enhance learning and provide much-needed breaks. Nevertheless, it is important to balance these benefits with the potential for students to struggle in finding time for themselves."

Essay to score:
"People have the right to make their own decisions in life, no matter how dangerous it could be or how much trouble any person could be in. We are the ones to make the decision to do something to change the future; we make that decision to try new things every day, even if we end up learning from our mistakes. When we make mistakes, sometimes it could lead to a new start, or other times it can lead to something bad, but we always learn from our mistakes.

People all around the world make decisions that are not the best, but you get to learn from your mistakes. Experts, authorities, doctors, teachers, lawyers, judges, priests, probably even the president—each and every one of these people, who has had a degree or done well in school, have made mistakes all the time. Even if it's something you might learn from, people still make mistakes, and nobody is perfect. No one can be perfect to the point that they never in their lives had ever made a mistake because the majority of the people around the world have made at least more than one mistake, and sometimes people don't realize that they have made them. For example, doctors can make the mistake of diagnosing the wrong patient; yes, it's risky and dangerous, but you learn from your mistakes, even if there are consequences at the end. Lawyers can make the mistake of accusing an innocent person during court; yes, people can be innocent before proven guilty, but what if they were scared to tell the truth and it turns out they really are innocent? People make mistakes all the time; some can be due to poor decision-making, but you still learn from everything you do.

The reason why people make their own decisions and not authorities is that some people hate having someone tell them what to do, and that is not a hypothesis—that is a fact. People genuinely like doing whatever they want, even if it's harmful or smart, but we end up learning the hard way about everything. People all around the world have the chance to make decisions to change the future for themselves or for their country. Some people have the right to be able to save lives with some of the decisions they make. Others can decide to help the homeless or be foster parents to help children or anyone out. Some decisions can be for good use, and others can be for greed, revenge, mistakes, or just a bad decision that could get you into some consequences. Every day, people make decisions, even if they're small decisions. Mistakes can happen all the time, but it's up to the person if they want to learn from their mistakes or not.

Life is not easy because you have lots of decisions to make every day without always knowing the outcome of that decision. Some people have it easy in life because of their decisions, and others have it really rough. Experts may or may not understand what someone is going through because they have never experienced it. People make their decisions for so many reasons. For example, a man might be going through stage three cancer and just wants people to understand that this is it; no more making decisions because he just wants to go. Experts would have probably said to take the treatment and be there with your family, but it is not the family's, friends', experts', or doctors' decision—it's the man's decision and his wishes. Experts do not have the right to make our decisions in life because the decisions that we make as an individual are unique in our own way. People may judge, consequences may happen, but it is you making the decision, thinking about what you feel is best for you, even if you want to make bad ones. No one has the right to make your decisions or your ideas; they cannot tell you what to do, no matter how much they want to, because in the end, it's you making the decision to listen or to ignore."

Essay to score:
"Do you agree or disagree that extending school hours is a good or bad thing to do? I disagree that extending school hours is a good idea because students would have less time at home, and it would be overwhelming for students to learn so much in one day.

Students shouldn't be in school for more than seven hours unless they are staying after school because they won't have time to relax at home. For example, if students are in school for six to seven hours, then they would have at least seven to eight or more hours to relax at home and do whatever they want. However, if we extend the day by one and a half hours, they would have at most six hours to relax at home before returning to school the next day. Additionally, students would have less time to do their homework, and if they don't complete it, they could get in trouble. Teachers might require them to finish their homework during lunch or stay after school. Furthermore, they would have less time to spend with their family members. Some people cherish their time with family and dislike having to leave them for school, work, or travel far from their parents' home.

It is not beneficial for students to learn too much because it could negatively impact their health. When students are overloaded with information, their brains may struggle to comprehend and solve problems, leading to stress and frustration. This could result in students wanting to give up, which is not a solution. Moreover, students might forget the material and then need to ask the teacher for help, which could lead to frustration on both sides. Another issue is that students might fall asleep in class due to boredom or exhaustion. If school hours are extended by one and a half hours, students might sleep in and arrive late, which is not desirable for teachers.

The school board should not add one and a half hours to each school day because it would reduce students' time at home and be detrimental to students like us to learn so many things during school. Therefore, students should not be overloaded with education because then they might forget everything and could eventually fail a grade, a test, a class, or even an SOL."

Essay to score:
"Have you ever gone camping before? If not, you should know that camping is the most adventurous thing in the world. It will be a new world to you, where you'll see a lot of nature and animals that you might have thought existed only in movies, but they are real! Another reason is that it will bring you closer to your family; you can do fun things together, and camping can teach you valuable lessons.

First of all, have you ever gone camping with your family where there was no internet at all? If yes, I assume that you went crazy because you can't live without your phone. But think for a moment: does a phone matter more than spending time with your loved ones?

If you say 'yes,' let me tell you that you are really wrong because spending time with family or friends is incredibly valuable. A family trip is meant to foster communication, to enjoy fun activities, and to support each other. For example, you can work together to set up a tent or to make a fire. Even though none of you may know how, it will still be a funny moment to see how each one of you tries to make it work.

Second, camping can teach you important lessons during the time you spend there. It can make you realize that living in the woods is not easy. You have to create your own shelter, make a fire to keep warm, and there is no electricity to communicate with someone. These challenges make you appreciate that many people around the world live in these conditions.

Finally, you will do a lot of fun things. For example, you can explore the woods to look for edible food, or you can search for animals such as a bunny, raccoon, or even a big brown bear if you are adventurous.

After that fun and adventurous mission, you can gather with your family in a big circle to tell scary stories that will make all your hairs stand on end. Or, if they don't like scary stories, they can share memories of all the happy moments they've experienced. And if you want to add more joy to the moment, you can enjoy s'mores made with two cookies, marshmallows, and delicious chocolate. That sounds good, right?

If you have never been camping before, I think you should give it a chance. Camping will give you some of the best memories with your family, show you more of the wilderness, and introduce you to the realities of camping. And I am sure you would like to eat a chocolatey marshmallow cookie, right?"

I believe students should not take online classes at home. Online classes are not like regular classes you take. Online classes have their own specific time that you have to be on your computer, and also how long you have to stay on your computer. The one thing that's hard about homeschooling is that you're not going to have friends. You're going to be by yourself all the time. But after saying all that, there is a little benefit of online school. The one reason why students want to take homeschooling is that you have until 11:59 PM to turn in your work; that means you have all day to do schoolwork, and also you can search things up when you don't know. I know all this because I took English 11 online this past summer.

Homeschooling doesn't have a lot of benefits. Homeschooling means that you take your classes online; it means you're going to be on your computer all day, and that's going to affect your health. It's going to affect your health means that it's going to make you wear glasses, and you're no longer going to see well without your glasses. The number one thing homeschooling doesn't benefit you is that it's a lot of work; it's like doing twenty times more work than school a day. The second thing homeschooling doesn't benefit you is that there's no one to control you like a teacher does, and you're not going to have help when you need help, like staying after, and teachers always try to make things easy for their students. The last and the third thing is that you're not going to have a lot of friends as you would in school, and you're not going to have a lot of fun like no prom, no homecoming; you're going to miss a lot of experiences taking classes at home, and you're going to struggle.

Students want to take classes at home because they think it's going to be easy. There are some benefits to taking classes at home; the one reason a lot of people take classes at home is that you have all day to do your work, and also you can wake up late if you want. You're not going to have a schedule like school does; when I say you can wake up any time you want, it's like you go on Blackboard, you get the worksheet for the day, and you have until 11:59 PM to do the work, and after you finish, you turn it in on Blackboard, so you have time to sleep and have fun. But the problem is that the worksheet takes around seven hours to do. The second benefit of homeschooling is that you can search anything you want, and there's no one there to control you, and no one is there to yell at you and tell you what to do.

I believe students should not take online classes at home. Online classes are not like regular classes you take. Online classes have their own specific time that you have to be on your computer, and also how long you have to stay on your computer. I don't recommend anyone to take homeschooling. I recommend going to school with your friends, having fun, and learning with your friends, getting help from teachers, and also the experience of school is way more important than you think for your future life because in your future life, your kids might ask you how was school in your days. Essay to score:
"According to an Albert Schweitzer quote, setting a good example through your own behavior is the best way to influence other people. However, one might wonder if there are better ways. Presenting a good example is a significant challenge because not everyone may be influenced by what you do or say. In this essay, I will discuss how people might relate to influence, the types of personalities people have, and people's perspectives about others.

People might relate to influence in ways that may seem crazy, but it's true. There are a lot of people who really need help, and we never see that because we only focus on ourselves and what we want. We seldom consider putting ourselves in someone else's situation, understanding what they are going through, or what they have to deal with every single day. We all go through difficult times and want to talk about it with someone, but it's so difficult to do because we are scared of what people might think or say about us, or sometimes we might not trust them. Those who can influence others might feel amazing knowing that by helping others, they help themselves too. Influencers help people open up to the world and let go of the stuff they have been through. Sometimes there are better ways to do it, but just by talking about a situation that you have been through, a lot of people can relate.

The kind of personality people have is a big argument because, nowadays, people do not really appreciate what others have done for them. Sometimes they just forget about the people who were there to help them or the ones that they helped in opening up to the world and letting their problems go away.

Your kind is one of the big words to represent yourself as an influence to people because you really want to help them, and they can relate to you. When you do something, it's because you really want to, not just for fun. For example, a lot of YouTubers nowadays have told the world a lot of stuff because they just wanted views or they pretended to be something they are not. Sometimes people might relate to their stories and support them, or sometimes people might not trust them. But in time, they have become important to the world. Sometimes they go over the line because they have become important. They start acting differently, and their fame makes them someone different just because they wanted the views and to become famous. Never forget who was there for you and how people related to you many times, because your kind of personality is what makes you significant.

People's perspective about others is a big issue nowadays because people judge them based on their looks or the way they act. They judge them because that's how they were raised, but they are wrong because they are not giving people the opportunity to know them or talk to them. How can people ask for help when they are suffering or going through a difficult time if they do not want to open up to others because they are judged by their appearance? However, they are not putting themselves in others' shoes. People like to judge, and they even think they are bad people. One day, when they want to become an influence to others, people might not want to relate to them because of their behavior towards others. What people never consider is that the person they judge might help them even more than they imagine because that person might be the one who can relate to their problems and solve them for you. And of course, there are always different ways to help.

In conclusion, influence yourself first, and then with your behavior, help others relate to you. But do not expect something from people who do not want to help. Expect from people in the same way. Nowadays, anyone can become an influence, but not everyone will relate to your influence in better ways than you can do by yourself. In my opinion, I agree with Albert Schweitzer because, based on what I have been through, I relate to the idea that setting a good example through my own behavior will help me influence others, and in certain ways too."

Essay to score:
"Imagine not having to wake up early in order to shower, eat, and put clothes on. Some schools offer the convenient choice of allowing students to study from home via online courses or through video. Some students are fortunate enough to learn from their own home, so they wouldn't go through these minor setbacks. Many students wish they were able to learn from home and not have to go to a public or private school. Students could also take courses that are necessary for them and could help them with things that are really needed for the rest of their lives. For these students, learning from home brings many benefits because students would not worry about getting to school, they would still be able to learn while sick, and they would learn at a pace they need.

First, the students wouldn't worry about how they were going to get to school. Students could relax a lot more knowing that they did not have to make those sacrifices to get to school. Having to make it on time to school adds an immense amount of pressure to a student because they know that their teacher would be angry for being late to class, but when taking online courses, they would be able to learn from home and not worry about making it on time. Being in a public school is all about timing because being late could result in lectures for hours on end and could get you in trouble with your administrator. This is why when you learn from home, you could do it any time throughout your day because it's an online course and it's available at all times. When you also learn from home, you're able to take your time on certain activities and other tasks. Depending on the weather, that could be even more time-consuming; for example, if it's snowing, you would have to warm your vehicle up in order to be able to drive it, and for people who walk to school, they suffer the most because they have to either sweat or be so cold on the way to school and on the way back.

Second, students wouldn't have to make it to school even when sick. Many schools suggest that students should stay home when sick in order to prevent the sickness from spreading to every other person in the building. When a student takes an online course, they could still learn from home without getting anyone else sick. Missing school could probably be one of the worst things because of the amount of work you would have to catch up on. Students that take online courses are a lot luckier because they are still able to learn from bed with any sort of sickness. Some students miss an important day like test days, but when they do, they have to wait to take the test and get a zero in the grade book until they complete the test on whatever makeup day is assigned to them. When students who take online courses miss the test day, they could complete it whenever, just because it's online and it won't have to be taken on a hard copy.

Lastly, the student would be able to learn at the pace that they desire. Students who attend public schools know that they don't always move at the desirable pace because there are many others learning with them. For example, when a student sits down in math class, the teacher is either really quick or really slow. But when online, you could ask the teacher to please repeat themselves and move at the pace you would really like. When a teacher has a class of twenty-plus kids, he or she really can't give you undivided attention because there are so many students in that class. For students who take online classes, they could have the full attention of the teacher because every student has one specific teacher assigned just for them; with this, they are able to learn a lot more and are able to move from subject to subject a lot quicker. The students who take the online class will also move at a much faster rate because they wouldn't have any sort of distractions but would give the teacher a lot more attention than they would in a public class.

Some schools across the United States offer students the choice to take online courses from home. This helps many students who have problems getting to school and home, it allows students to learn at the pace they will be more successful at, and would help when a student is not feeling well enough to go to school. Many of the students wish they were able to take an online course, which is much better than an online school."

"Energy is very important in our lives today. Without energy, we cannot survive because most people use it daily, and our businesses rely on it. Therefore, I strongly disagree with this choice for several reasons: We will be using more energy than what we actually use on a daily basis; moreover, students will have to spend more time in classes, which is too much for their brains to handle or concentrate for that long. However, looking further and searching for alternative sources that we can use in the near future is a good start.

The first reason I believe is that we will be wasting more energy than we usually do. If we add the number of hours that we waste on energy that we consume now, it will be less than in a four-day work week, which eliminates it for now. Also, there will be more pressure on electronic machines than we usually exert, which could cause damage and cost money. Coupled with that, workers and students will spend more time at work than usual, which seems more exhausting than what they currently experience.

Secondly, students will spend more time in school. With the current schedule, students encounter some troubles that make them struggle with the time they wake up and leave school. Some students suffer from laziness during school because of the long extended schedule. So, adding four more hours to their regular day will decrease their ability to concentrate in class, which leads to a huge increase in the number of failing students every school year, which parents do not wish for. Other than that, we can find alternative resources that can be renewable or nonrenewable to maintain power.

Lastly, looking for other sources that have the same quality is essential. In general, the world has a lot of renewable and nonrenewable resources that can help us keep the energy as it is. For example, CCT, which is clean coal technology, is based on burning coal using developed vents with filters that can reduce air pollution. Moreover, we can use solar cells to make resources even in case we need an alternative.

Last but not least, people should try their best to conserve energy and resources to make life better for themselves and the next generations. Extending school and work hours to ten days is a below-average solution to solve our issue, but humans can find different ways to maintain energy.

Human beings can be creative if we use our nature to find resources that can make our lives easier."

"I agree with the Ralph Waldo Emerson quote, and I'm going to tell you why.

To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment, and I am very grateful for that.

First of all, this world, in a way, is trying to change us, but we can't let it because whatever we are trying to do in life is what we are going to chase, and we are going to keep chasing it because we can do whatever we set our minds to. The world is life, and life hits us with unexpected things, but you know what? We can fight it, no matter how hard it hits us because us human beings are stronger than we think we are. Most importantly, we are strong when we come together and fight together as human beings.

In addition, some people would just give up when life finally hits them; they don't keep going because they don't have that motivation in them, or they don't have anyone to motivate them. That's why we, as humans, should come together so more people can have that motivation, and so we can start spreading that motivation. That word, motivation, is key because that's one of the things that keeps us going in life. Always repeat that in your head, and if you don't know what it means, look it up and read what it says because then you would understand why you do the things that you do, why you behave the way that you behave. You have no motivation and don't think that you have nothing that motivates you; everyone in this world has something that motivates them. You just haven't opened your eyes wide enough to see it yourself, but one day you will, and when that day comes, you will feel like you have made the biggest accomplishment of your life. I'm very grateful for what I have in life and very grateful for who I am today, an eighteen-year-old high school student trying to do what I'm going to do in the future and not letting the world, also known as life, take over me.

Lastly, being myself, who I am today, is the biggest and greatest accomplishment of my life because I stood my ground and took on life. If it wasn't for my motivations, I wouldn't have made it to where I am today and loving the things I love to do. I would say that I had a rough start in life, but that's the thing; most people have rough starts, but they come back from it, and gratefully, that's what happened to me, and I'm very, very grateful for that. For the people that are still hanging in there, find your motivation, find what you love to do because once you find it and love to do it, that's your motivation, and that's what you can do to get back up again and to be yourself again. It's never too late to start, and it's not as easy as you think, but it is sure as hell worth it. All you have to do is stop what you're doing and go find it now. Ralph Waldo Emerson is a wise man, and what he is saying in this quote is very true, and I agree with him on it.

The world ain't all sunshine and rainbows; it's a very mean and nasty place, and I don't care how tough you are, it will beat you to your knees and keep you there permanently if you let it. You, me, or nobody is going to hit as hard as life, but it ain't about how hard you hit; it's about how hard you can get hit and keep moving forward, how much you can take and keep moving forward. That's how winning is done. Now, if you know what you're worth, then go on and get what you're worth, but you have to be willing to take the hits and not point fingers saying you aren't who you want to be because of him, or her, or anybody. Cowards do that, and that ain't you."

Essay to score:
"Technology enables individuals to accomplish numerous tasks without interacting with others. People can check out books, shop, and play games without conversing with another person. Technology negatively impacts people's lives because in-person communication has diminished. Technology has transformed how people live; they now remain indoors, glued to their computers, tablets, and phones. The adverse effect of technology is evident as few people wish to engage in face-to-face conversations. Instead, they prefer to communicate via their cellphones. 

Technology provides all the necessary information to complete tasks without the need to inquire directly from another individual. It guides you through each step required to finish work, a project, or research independently. While technology enables us to find everything, it does so without the need for communication with a teacher, tutor, or manager for assistance. 

People can obtain books, shop, and entertain themselves without human interaction. Individuals increasingly rely on technology to acquire desired items without the need to walk or drive to stores. The convenience of apps that deliver goods to one's doorstep in mere hours or minutes discourages people from leaving their homes. The impact of technology is detrimental as it fosters addiction to phones and computers. Most concerning is the potential loss of interpersonal communication skills. 

The decline in face-to-face communication is a direct result of technology's influence. People have become accustomed to phone calls as a substitute for in-person interactions. Some may avoid direct conversation due to fear or shyness, opting instead for text messages or phone calls. Those who are reticent to talk may prefer texting or calling the person in question. 

The pervasive use of electronic devices at home has altered daily life. The negative consequences include potential vision impairment from prolonged screen exposure and a lack of awareness of one's surroundings. Relying solely on technology for learning, without leaving the house, limits educational experiences. Moreover, people may be at a loss when technology is unavailable, even temporarily. 

In conclusion, technology hinders face-to-face communication and prevents us from seeking assistance from teachers, tutors, parents, or friends."

Essay to score:
"Should the school follow the model by extending the school day by two hours? This question arises after considering the conservation of energy and resources, along with the benefits and disadvantages of a four-day school week.

Nowadays, the conservation of energy and resources is more common in enterprises and businesses because these resources are depleting very quickly. However, these companies are reflecting on the damage that could occur if they do not take action. Many companies have adopted a four-day work week, with each day consisting of ten hours. On the other hand, schools are also dealing with this new system of work. Are they adopting the same four-day model, but could reducing the time for learning affect the students?

Most schools follow a five-day teaching model with approximately eight hours each day. But now, by adopting the new model to conserve energy and save resources, schools are considering four-day weeks, extending each day by two hours. In my opinion, it is a well-intentioned idea to help conserve the world's resources and energy. However, I disagree with cutting two hours of learning time. We should have more time to study to achieve our future goals, and by having two fewer hours, we are just wasting time in school. For example, a student needs approximately eight hours over five days a week, reviewing four assignments a day, which means for each assignment, the student has to spend an hour and a half to at least retain something. Two hours less does not cover the time we need to study.

Revisiting the viewpoint of saving resources and energy, we know it is necessary for our lives, and our task is to learn how to protect them. However, there are other ways to do this without reducing the school day by two hours. For instance, businesses or environmental organizations could dedicate a day solely to the planet Earth. Companies could divide tasks such as cleaning rivers, picking up trash, planting trees, and turning off power plants that emit smoke. Additionally, implementing renewable energy in schools can help; for example, solar panels on the school's roof can contribute to the development of renewable energy and save a lot of resources. In my opinion, this is the correct approach to take without changing any schedules in schools or businesses. Arctic countries implement this kind of model; they conserve resources, and people work a manageable schedule. That's why Arctic countries have a high standard of living and are known as some of the most beautiful places to visit and live.

As I said before, the school does not need to extend the day by two hours. Extending the school day is not about avoiding penalties; it's about making students leave home early, spending their time on games or hanging out on the streets with untrustworthy friends, instead of being in a classroom gaining knowledge and discovering new things that can help them build their future. Working on tablets at home will not help students learn as effectively as they do in school; most students do not even use a tablet to work because they are either lazy or they do not understand the topic and need a teacher, which would not be possible with two fewer hours of learning time. That's why I disagree with this model of conserving energy and resources, which can be addressed in other ways, as I mentioned earlier.

In my humble conclusion, schools should operate as usual because it is where students forge their futures, and it is one of the few places where they are mostly safe. Therefore, extending the school day by two hours would be a waste of time and not provide enough time to educate the students. On the other hand, while energy and resources are vital for the world to function, there are other ways to manage them without affecting businesses, factories, enterprises, and schools with limited hours of study. I believe that everything is possible, and if we really want to make a difference with renewable resources, we can do so without affecting the schools. Let the students spend more time in school, not wasting the rest of the day doing nothing."

Essay to score:
"Some people believe that students should be required to take music, drama, or art classes. Should students be required to take a class in the arts, or should such classes be electives? Students can take those classes if they choose to because they have the right to do so. Conversely, if they do not wish to, they have the right to select other elective classes as well. Indeed, these classes should be electives, allowing students to choose based on their interests, such as drawing, singing, or acting, or any other elective they wish to pursue. There are reasons why they might opt for elective classes.

The first reason why they should take elective classes is to fill up their schedules. After completing their core classes like math, science, and history, students need electives. These classes provide knowledge about subjects that students might not have encountered before. For instance, in music, they might learn how to play an instrument or sing correctly, while art class could teach them various drawing and coloring techniques.

The second reason is that electives contribute points to their GPA for their high school diploma. Students have the right to choose their elective classes rather than having them assigned by a counselor. If students are not interested in a class, they may not attend or engage with the material. Electives could potentially lead to future musicians, artists, and actors, but we cannot predict this. Some elective classes, such as computer information, may be directly beneficial for future careers.

The third and final reason students need elective classes is for entertainment and to take a break from their other academic responsibilities. Electives can provide fun and create memories. For example, in my last year of high school, I am enjoying the elective classes I have chosen. In my opinion, students often take elective classes because they need them to graduate, but sometimes they do not because they already have all the credits required.

In conclusion, students can take elective classes if they wish, or they can choose others, as they have the right to do so. Students are required to take them to complete their schedules and to graduate. Elective classes are beneficial because they offer the opportunity to learn about a variety of subjects. Ultimately, electives can provide us with memories to cherish in the future. Some students take them out of interest and a desire to learn more about the subject. However, in the end, students must take them to graduate and perhaps to enjoy their experiences in these classes."

"Energy and Resources Conservation

Hello there, reader. How are you doing? I hope you're doing well.

I know, I know. We're close to Thanksgiving, and all we want to talk about is what we're going to do on this holiday. I mean, at least, that's what I want to do. Five days without school—that's going to be awesome.

But there are other things that matter more than that, like energy and resources conservation, don't you think? So, let's start with this prompt.

First of all, do you know what conserving energy and resources means? I'm sure you do. But I'm going to tell you anyway, just in case you don't. It means to reduce or try to use less energy and resources.

Just so we're clear, this is the first time I've heard that some businesses have adopted a four-day workweek with each day consisting of ten hours, in order to reduce the consumption of energy and resources.

Energy.

Two more hours of school means a lot more energy consumption than what we have now: more computer use, more smartboard use, air conditioning use, and more lighting. Because those things consume energy. Every time you have a light on or any other electrical device on, you are consuming energy. So if the school doesn't want to lose energy, adding two more hours to the school day is a bad idea.

Water.

Water is the second thing that the school is going to consume more of. The students like to go to the bathroom a lot. Sometimes they just go because they don't want to be in class or they want to use their phone, and they start to play with the water as if they paid for it. And I don't know about you, but I don't like to waste water, because water is not free in this country—somebody is paying for it.

My opinion? If the school wants to conserve energy and resources, I don't think that the school should follow this model by extending the school day by two hours. Because instead of conserving energy and resources, the school is going to use more of it every day.

Written by
Generic_Name"

I believe that 4 years of high school would be a lot better because by then you'd have a clearer idea of what you want your career to be. If you take only 3 years of school, you might have to take classes during the summer, may not be able to take elective classes, or might even have more school hours. That is why I feel it'd be better to have 4 years of school and take things nice and easy.

I'd like to start by saying that if you have only 3 years of high school, you'll be able to graduate early but probably won't know what you want to become; you might not even have an idea of what you want to be. I'm a junior this year, and I still don't know what I'd want to be, whether it's becoming a mechanic or a doctor, and those are only two careers out of the many there are. That is why it is better to have more time to be able to find out what we/you want to be or at least get an idea of what that is.

Also, if you have only 3 years of school, you'll have to think about the classes. You're going to have to take all your required classes first, meaning you won't have many electives. If you did have electives, you're going to most likely have more school hours, so that would mean less time at home, less time with family, and if you work, you'd have to work late. So, you have to think about how a 3-year school would operate. You can graduate early but will have more hours of school.

So finally, you might be thinking, "If I have only 3 years of high school, that means I'll be able to graduate early and attend college early," but then again, like I said before, what if you don't know what you want to be? I hope I made you think about your decision and am making you agree with me that it's better to have 4 years of high school instead of 3."

Essay to score:
"Should students identify a career by the time they enter high school at a young age? Do you agree or disagree?

I disagree because they are still too young to commit to a career as they just enter high school. Being in a career involves a lot of responsibility, and they still need to learn more before embarking on a career path. Learning about a career is akin to learning about a job, and to make an informed decision about what you want to do for the rest of your life, you need to have a broad understanding and be well-prepared. I think that grades should be A, B, or C, and when their grades are good and they are passing, they can consider a career in the 10th grade, but not in the 9th grade. Therefore, I do not agree that students can come to high school and immediately choose a career, especially since 50% of the students in 9th grade are not passing their classes.

First, there are some students who just enter high school and still don't understand responsibility. A career is a significant responsibility, typically for juniors and seniors. By the 10th grade, if they have completed English 10, they can sign up for a career and get ready for it. They can choose whatever career they want, like nursing, mechanics, etc., and they will study for it.

Second, if they are 16 years old, they can choose a career, but if they are not, they cannot. They are still young. Like me, they did not give me a chance. I wanted to be a nurse, but I was not given the opportunity. Now, I think I will go to college and study to be a teacher, or I don't really know because at the same time, I think I want to be famous, like trying to be in a movie. As a junior, I still don't know what career I want because we were not given other choices to study. I wish we could have had other options in school, not just nursing, because not everyone has the opportunity, even if they apply.

Third, I think they should talk with students about careers before they are in 10th grade and ask them if they are ready to commit to a career. However, they are still young and should not be forced to choose at a young age. If they are 16 or older, then they should be allowed to choose a career, but if they are younger, they should not. They should be informed about careers but not pressured into choosing one.

In my opinion, they should not let students choose a career because they are still too young and need to learn more about responsibility. For example, my best friend, Generic_Name, is in 9th grade and knows about responsibility; she takes care of her little brother and knows what career she wants to pursue—a soccer player. She is good at soccer and is a kind and good friend. There should be more 9th graders like her who understand responsibility. However, there are 9th graders who don't even respect their teachers and families, which shows they don't understand responsibility yet. They should respect their teachers and families because that shows they are responsible. Some students who enter high school don't respect others, even those in 10th, 11th, and 12th grades. That's why they should not be allowed to select a career first; they have to show respect to their teachers, families, and themselves."

Essay to score:
"Students should not be expected to commit to a career by the time they get to high school. It's such a difficult and important decision to make that not even students who are about to graduate from high school know the answer to. Students also have a life outside of school that they have to keep up with and manage, like their friendships. Going into high school is a very hard transition for all students, especially mentally, because they have to adapt to lots of new things.

Choosing a career at a young age is not the best decision for students; it's a very important choice that sticks with you for the rest of your life. It would be too early for students to know what they want to study. They're still young and have to develop their mentality. They should have time to try different courses that they are interested in during high school and not choose right away. They would feel forced to choose a career that they really don't want to take. Waiting out the four high school years would be the best decision because they would still have time to take different courses and see which course they are really interested in.

A third reason I think it's important to learn from the experience of others is that you could end up in worse situations than you could already be in. Essay to score:
"People say that you are free to do or to be whatever you want, but do you really think that is true?

Let's say this: if your look is all dark and evil, do you think you can get a job in a daycare? We have to be honest; people just want everyone to look perfect in their eyes.

For instance, we can talk about all the pretty models. They have to be thin and have the perfect size and all that stuff. But do you really think that they are happy? I mean, who doesn't want to be a top model, right? But it's not that easy, and just because you see all the beauty, that's what you want to see because that's all that we care about. We never see or try to see more than what they show us, and guess what? We buy all that because we want to be more of what they want to see; we try to be more than them.

Now, that was about our appearance, but what can we say about how we really feel about it? Well, famous people, do you really think that they are honest with us? Let's see, all these famous people that try to show us their "real life." Do you really think that is the real them? They just pretend to be what we want to see. However, that is what we like to see, and we want to be like them, buy whatever they have, live how they live, and just try to be "perfect" as we think they are. But what about our feelings or their feelings? How can we show love when we don't love ourselves first? Why do I say this? Because if you do not accept yourself, how can you love it?

So, when we think about how we can show the world who we are, we have to think, "Do I really be who I want to be?" People always have something to say about you, no matter who you are or who you want to be. And it's hard because sometimes you have to pretend to be someone completely different just for your job, school, family, and everyone around you because you're afraid to lose their company or what they bring to you.

And that is how our world works. It's complicated, but that's how we live, and not because we prefer it. It's because everyone has a different concept of freedom, and most of them think that they can make you and don't let you make yourself. In my opinion, that is why "to be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment."

Sincerely, Ralph W. Emerson"

"A Program That Benefits Both Older and Younger Students. Have you ever experienced a program that involves both older and younger students, or wondered if the students would be able to admire each other? Older students have more experience than the younger ones, which makes it easier for them to handle problems. It also helps them to build stronger relationships since they come from different backgrounds. It will be easy for them to bring up ideas for a particular project because they both have different experiences. The program will help both groups of students because they can have things like competitions, and they can also learn from each other and achieve the goals they have planned for that class, particularly if they work as a team.

Firstly, such a program will benefit both older and younger students because they can have things such as competitions. Both groups will try their best and put in much effort because either they want to be ahead of each other, or they want to succeed in that program. They make sure that they value their time and make their books their 'best friend.'

There is a quote that states, 'Education is the key to success.'

When students try to compete with others, they study harder to attain their dreams and also to make people believe in them. Such competitions make students study harder and also make them successful.

Secondly, such a program will benefit both students because 'they can both learn from each other.'

For instance, if I have been paired with someone who is three years older than me to do an assignment, it makes it easier for us to complete the assignment. It is because we are both from different backgrounds and also raised and trained by different people. That alone will help us learn from each other because we will not want to work with each other without getting to know ourselves. When we realize we are from different places, we will be interested in knowing a little bit about each other's background and how we do our things. Learning from each other benefits both of us, especially when we know about our likes and dislikes.

Lastly, both students benefit from such a program because they can achieve the goals they have planned for that class, particularly if they work as a team. There is a quote I remember that says, 'Two heads are better than one.' For example, if one person can carry twenty out of fifty books, then two people will be able to carry all fifty books or even more. The students have goals and dreams they want to acquire in life. However, since they both have the same purpose, they will decide to work together to help each other reach their goals.

Conclusively, both students will benefit from such a program because they can compete against each other and put in much effort to reach their dreams, to also learn about each other, and to help each other strive for their goals. The effects of a program that helps both older and younger students to pair up and help each other have been listed in the essay above. Students can be assisted by people who are older, younger, or even of a different race or gender."

"Three years ago, when I was new to this country, I didn't know any English, but I learned some words in my English class. I remember that the school year was almost over, and my English teacher hadn't assigned any books to read. The hard part was when summer ended and we started school again; I didn't remember any English at all. For the following summer, my counselor spoke to my new English teacher and told her that I needed to read a lot in English. My counselor also asked my English teacher to give me books to read during the next summer, and she did. That helped me a lot to improve my second language skills; I didn't forget anything at all. Some people say that summer projects should not be designed by teachers because students will not have time to learn things that they want to learn by themselves. Actually, summer projects should be designed by teachers because they will create specific projects to help students prepare for the next school years, and students will not forget what they learned before because they will continue learning.

Many people say that summer projects should not be designed by teachers because if teachers design projects for students, the students will not have the opportunity to design projects for things they want to learn. For example, students get very stressed during the school year and they want to do something fun like watching TV, playing video games, and going out with their family. However, students can do all that they want to do when teachers design projects for them. Students have the whole day, so they can do the projects that teachers assign them and still have fun.

The first reason teachers should design summer projects is that it will help students prepare for the next school year. Teachers know what students will need to know and how difficult the class is going to be if the student is not prepared for the next year. For example, some students are very bad at math and they don't get any projects designed by teachers during the summer. When the student is back to school and he gets a higher math class, he will have a struggle because the teacher didn't assign any project for the student during the summer. Also, teachers should design projects for students because students don't know about the new classes that they will take. It's hard for students to create their own projects to learn.

The second reason is that teachers should design projects for students because that will help students not forget what they learned the year before. If teachers design projects, it will help students to review what they learned and not forget a lot because students will continue learning. Some students are very far away from home because they are on vacation, but they can do everything from where they are. The projects that teachers design may be on computers, and students can take 10 to 15 minutes to work on projects, so they are learning and having fun during the summer. Essay to score:
"As much as I love being lazy, I support the fact that everyone should be active all the time. Some might say that having some rest is good, but too much rest is not beneficial all the time. The phrase 'being active' has different meanings for different types of people. For me, I define it as studying, doing my homework, or even completing my chores, but for some people, it might involve doing their jobs, researching, or even helping out others.

Being active has changed as time has changed. Long before technology, many people worked actively; they didn't have social media, phones, computers, or even emails. They did everything by hand. But nowadays, almost everyone sits at home and lets technology take control. This has both bad and good effects, but the bad side has the majority effect. These adverse effects have brought health problems like obesity, diabetes, and so on. Being active can also mean working out.

I believe if someone works actively towards achieving their goals, they can accomplish anything they want (if it is realistic, of course). We can see some famous scientists like Albert Einstein, Stephen Hawking, and Thomas Edison who worked day and night to prove something for society, and I believe these people changed the way we are living right now.

Having said all this, I am such a lazy person that completely agrees with what Thomas Jefferson wrote. So, in conclusion, please don't be lazy all the time. Think about your future, your health, and the things that you can accomplish. So get up and be active."
