Essay to score:
"Should students benefit from and be allowed to be homeschooled?

In my honest opinion, I think students should benefit from being homeschooled because there would be fewer distractions than in actual public or private schools.

I believe this is true because there are a lot of distractions in school, and students do not realize that these distractions could be the cause of why they are not learning and possibly why they might be failing their classes. For example, students often arrive late to class because they are hanging out with their friends in the halls and paying less attention to their timely schedule at school. If a student arrives late to class, they have missed part of what they are supposed to learn for the day and distract others from their learning.

Another reason why students could benefit from being homeschooled is that there would be no attendance policy, and they could learn things faster. This is true because there are always those students who arrive at school or class late and have already missed out on half of the lesson because they couldn't get themselves up in the morning to get to school. Also, walking into class late not only ruins your learning time but also distracts others who are trying to learn. If you are homeschooled, you are also learning things faster because you don't have anybody holding you back from your learning time, and you get to move at a faster pace than others. For example, if some students cannot figure out how to complete a lesson, it just makes it slower for the class because everyone has to understand the subject in order to move on to the next portion of the lesson.

However, there are reasons why I do not think students would benefit from being schooled at home. One reason is that the amount of learning time set up at home would be different than at school; for example, students might get too comfortable at home and think they can get up from bed at whatever time they please. Another example of why a student would not benefit from being schooled at home is that the homeschool student might be distracted by their surroundings. Since the student is very familiar with their environment at home, it would be very hard to pay attention and listen to what they are learning because they are distracted by their familiar surroundings.

In conclusion, these are all the reasons and examples as to why I think students should benefit from and be allowed to be homeschooled."

"Imagine not having control of your life. Although some say your character is formed by other people's influence, actually, you choose to be your own character. When you choose your character, you have more control, and you don't care what people think, because it's you.

When your character is made from influence, you start to feel like you are exactly like the people who influence you. When your parents teach you something and you listen, it stays with you. When they tell you to stop pointing at people or to be respectful, you get those characteristics stuck into you. Then, when you get those characteristics, you teach them to others. Therefore, you have no control of your character, and you're influencing others.

Even though you choose to be yourself, some people might not accept that and might not like you for it. That's why when you feel low, someone might say, 'Just be yourself,' and so you do. Therefore, you might not even care what people say about you. When you choose to be yourself, there are no rules; you are you, and nobody can stop you.

In addition, when you are being yourself, you can change some people's perspectives of you, and they might follow your direction. In conclusion, it is better to choose your own character.

Although some say your character is formed by other people's influence, actually, you choose to be your own character."

I love track and field; I run track for my school, and I am telling you, it is nowhere near easy. In the future, I would like to become a track star because track is what I love, and it pays a lot of money as well. But track is so hard because it takes everything out of your body. Running track will make you want to give up on life, make you feel like you are less than others, and make you so angry that if someone says you are not good, you might want to lash out. But the best part about track is when you win races at your track meets; it will put a big smile on your face and let you say in your head, 'Yes, this is what I work so hard for.' Track can lead to sleepless nights because your legs are so cramped you can't even sleep; you just have to stay up all night, cry, and ask God why He is doing this to you. But if you really want something in life, all you have to do is work hard because one day all the hard work is going to pay off, and best believe it is going to pay off because God has our back, and He always will. So just work hard toward your goals; if you want to achieve something in life, go for it."

"People have been using examples of their behavior over the years as a good way of learning, teaching, and influencing others. However, I believe that giving examples is not the only way that we, as humans, can learn from. Because as humans, we have many special abilities for learning, we can learn and influence ourselves based on what happens in our lives—all the good moments and the bad moments that we go through. For example, being caught stealing or breaking into private property puts our lives in a bad situation. We can go to jail, and from being in jail, we can influence ourselves to become a better person.

Schools and teachers should organize more tours for students and take them to the saddest and poorest parts of the cities where people sell drugs, where there is a lot of crime, the streets are full of trash, and people are living on the streets. This is to show them and, at the same time, encourage them that if they don't apply themselves in school, they could end up like these poor people. Students will learn and change their minds and take school more seriously because, as humans, we have the power to control our minds and change the way we think. When students see these poor people living in extremely bad conditions and surrounded by all types of crimes, they understand that their lives could end at any moment because there is no police protection when they are being attacked. These tours may be a good way to influence students to study and prepare for their future with a wealthy life.

I believe people can influence their lives in many ways, like being in prison for a minor charge. Prison is a good way and a good place to influence and encourage people to change their lives for the better and help them make good decisions when they are free again for a second chance in the real world. While being in prison, people can learn so much because if they did not receive any kind of school teaching, I believe many prisons allow prisoners to take some school for those who are trying to remake their lives. When they are free, prisoners will be more prepared and ready to not waste the second chance of being free. Prison can influence people not to commit crimes again because people will know that being in prison is not the best and smartest way to spend our lives on earth. That's why prison is a good place to influence people.

A good way to influence people is by creating programs or activities with people who don't have legs or some of them arms, but they still can do a lot of things and a lot of them don't depend on others to have a life. This will influence people who have a complete body. We complain about our bodies; it's important to teach people that no matter if we are missing an arm or a leg, we can still have a normal life. Sometimes we say that we cannot find a job or that we cannot do certain types of jobs, when people who don't have a complete body can find jobs. These programs can influence people to stop complaining because we have everything, while people who don't have legs can still do everything without complaining.

Examples of life behavior are not the only way that can influence people. There are many ways that can change a person's life, like being charged with crimes of stealing, assaulting someone, or entering private property, and being sentenced for a couple of years in prison. It can also encourage their lives from others who don't have a complete body because they were born without a leg or an arm. That's why I believe that examples of life behavior can be a good way to influence people, but there can be more ways to make people change their lives and make better decisions."

"Yes, working alone can help, but working in a group can get a lot more done in a matter of time. I believe that students should work in groups because studies say that working in a group can help bring more ideas in. I think groups of students can get more work done in an amount of time.

A few years ago, I was in an English class, and the teacher would ask the class how they would like to work. Some students raised their hands to work alone, while others preferred groups. I chose to work alone, and while I was working, I was struggling. I was not getting any clue on what I was supposed to do, and other students who were working in groups were done in the right amount of time.

Teachers should make students work in groups because it helps students brainstorm with each other's ideas. However, some students prefer to work alone because they think working in a group can cause distractions among peers. It is understandable if they want to work alone, but the point is, in a group of students, you can gather information and bring it to one conclusion. It is very common for a group of students to have side conversations; that's why we have administrators if any student is causing problems in class. So, I believe students should work in groups because with each other, they can come up with one big topic with many pieces of information and many ideas. Moreover, it is a better way to learn because studies show that high school students are more open when they are talking with their peers. Students get together and work."
